title: CLEANED-R (Comprehensive Livestock Environmental Assessment for Improved Nutrition, a Secured Environment and Sustainable Development along Livestock and Fish Value Chains) tool
narrative: Spatially explicit environmental ex-ante impact assessment tool for assessing changes from transforming livestock value chains

title: Global community seedbanks platform
narrative: Bioversity International, in collaboration with a number of research and development organizations from Austria, Brazil, China, Nepal, Peru, the Netherlands and Zimbabwe, established a global community seedbanks platform to facilitate connections among community seedbanks and community seedbank networks, scale out their activities and achievements and contribute to their sustainability. The platform will provide technical and organizational support, collect/share basic data; compile/share practical experiences and successes; support national and international policy development; and promote national networking.

title: New method for GHG measurements with closed chambers at night time
narrative: The standard closed chamber method for GHG measurements in rice has certain limitations (e.g. time, number of chambers, logistics). The newly proposed variation of this method with gas sampling being conducted at nighttime more chambers can be used at the same time over a longer closure duration. An analysis of a large Eddy Covariance data set showed a linear relationship between nocturnal fluxes and the full 24-hour fluxes.

title: Food security and drought monitoring and early warning tool considering local vulnerabilities
narrative: Digital platform for food security and drought monitoring and evaluation at the community level, integrating mobile data collection, estimation of a municipal acute food insecurity index, data management, analysis and dissemination.

title: Out-yield hybrids selected for the three agricultural environments of Mexico: lowland tropical, subtropical and highlands.
narrative: 47 hybrids were selected due to their competitive yield and favorable agronomic characteristics in comparison with commercial-testers (three-to-nine evaluation sites). In 2019, yield-validation-trials will be carried out in more than 40 locations. In 2020, the competitive hybrids from the validation-trials will be able to be released to the project seed-companies.

title: 5 hybrids of high yield potential for the seed sector of Mexico
narrative: Five hybrids were selected to be released to the project (MasAgro Maize) seed companies. These hybrids are competitive in terms of yield and agronomic characteristics compared to commercial testers. The hybrids to be released are two for lowland tropical, two for subtropical and one for the highlands of Mexico´s mega-environments.

title: 4 new out-yield hybrids of CIMMYT in the Mexican maize seed market.
narrative: The MasAgro-Maize project has released more than 40 maize hybrids and varieties to the Mexican seed sector . In 2018, 41 CIMMYT hybrids and varieties were produced and sold by the MasAgro-Maize seed companies, four hybrids, which were integrated for the first time into the Mexican maize seed market.

title: improved multiple stress tolerant varieties that effectively address emerging and future production
narrative: lines from which hybrids were released: MH50STR, MH51STR , MH52STR, AMANA-1 , AMANA-2, ACR06 TZL COMP3 C4  ,AFLATOXIN SYN2-YF2, PVA SYN 6,PVA SYN 13, TZL COMP4 C4  , Obatanpa/TZLCOMP1SYNW-1/TZLCOMP1SYNW-1,((TZL COMP1-W C6*2/(White DT STR Syn))-DT C1,MAQPMSYN-1,MASYN-VAR4 , MASYN-VAR5 ,CRI Apraku, ((TZL COMP1-W C6*2/(White DT STR Syn))-DT C1, EVDT 99-QPM , TZEE-W

title: Innovation platforms for Climate Smart Agriculture in Honduras
narrative: CSA innovation platform is an institutional innovation to facilitate cross learning and coordination for innovation testing and implementation

title: Demonstrated impact of food-assisted maternal and child health and nutrition program on maternal and child nutritional status in Guatemala and Burundi
narrative: Food-assisted maternal and child health and nutrition (FA-MCHN) programs are widely used to address undernutrition, but little is known about their effectiveness in improving child linear growth. Using a robust cluster randomized controlled study design, this evaluation provides insights on how to improve the nutritional status of children in the worst-off households in vulnerable contexts, such as Guatemala and Burundi.

title: Gender-differentiated indicator of nominal rate of protection - a methodology to understand the differentiated impacts of policies on women and men
narrative: Household level surveys (World Bank LSMS) and data from the Ag Incentives Consortium were used to compute national gender-differentiated nominal rates  of protection (NRPs). This new methodology brings a gender lens to our understanding of agricultural policies and can help policy makers understand the differentiated impacts of policies on women and men.

title: Dataset on yield changes due to climate change based on Agricultural Model intercomparison and improvement project (AgMIP) Global Gridded Crop Model Intercomparison
narrative: New methodology that merged together the most useful and accurate results from the AgMIP (Agricultural Model intercomparison and improvement project) GGCMI (Global Gridded Crop Model Intercomparison) crop model comparison for the world.

title: Decision-making tool for national implementation of the Plant Treatys multilateral system of access and benefit-sharing
narrative: The decision making tool is designed to assist policy actors to identify appropriate measures to implement the Plant Treaty’s multilateral system of access and benefit-sharing. The decision-making tool is divided into the eleven sections corresponding to issues that national-level policy actors need to address. Each section includes draft ‘baseline’ legal provisions related to each option; these can be adapted/incorporated into new laws and administrative guidelines.

title: Using roof-top rainwater harvesting system (RWHS) to irrigate home-based vegetable gardens in Laos
narrative: A model combining a rainwater harvesting systems (RWHS) water balance and a crop water balance was developed to simulate various scenarios of cropping cycles irrigated by a RWHS with varying dimensions. This model ran at a daily time step aimed to assess how the roof and vegetable garden areas and tank capacity influence crop yields, for different cropping calendars and rainfall years.

title: Climate-Related Risk Maps and Adaptation Plans (Climate Smart MAP) for Rice Production in Vietnam's Mekong River Delta
narrative: The climate-related risks maps and adaptation plans (Climate Smart MAP/CS-MAP) is a participatory approach involving experts from various local and national offices for (1) identifying climate-related risks; (2) delineating affected areas and risk levels; (3) proposing corresponding adaptive plans; (4) fine-tuning and verifying propose measures; and (5) developing integrated provincial and regional adaptation plans. Risk maps were developed for normal and ENSO years by using technical data, infrastructures, and local observations.

title: Joint village land use planning in Tanzania
narrative: Joint village land use planning (JVLUP) allows villages to plan land use collectively to share resources such as grazing and water. It is led by village authorities, with technical support from district government participatory land use management team (PLUM). ILRI and partners are supporting the piloting and upscaling. It is a key stepping stone to collective/group land titles, and rangeland management planning. It resolves land use conflicts between pastoralists and farmers through consultation, negotiation, agreement.

title: Woreda Participatory Land Use Planning for Pastoral Areas in Ethiopia
narrative: Woreda Participatory Land Use Planning (WPLUP) for Pastoral Areas is a process undertaken by district-level government experts working with local land users, to develop a land use plan for better managing and protecting rangelands, and for woreda development planning. 'Joint' WPLUP has also been introduced to prevent rangeland fragmentation, learning from joint village land use planning in Tanzania. A drylands-specific land capability classification is included. ILRI provided significant technical support to the development of WPLUP.

title: 28 new pre-breeding wheat lines with high yield potential and climate resilience for Mexico's growing regions.
narrative: 28 outstanding wheat lines identified with physiological traits conferring high yields and climate resilience for Mexico’s growing regions.

title: Seven bread and five durum wheat lines selected in collaboration with INIFAP are variety release candidates.
narrative: Seven bread and five durum wheat lines selected in collaboration with INIFAP are variety release candidates.

title: 10 new wheat varieties multiplied in collaboration with seed producers located in strategic growing areas of Mexico.
narrative: 10 new wheat varieties multiplied in collaboration with Mexican seed producers located in strategic growing areas. The multiplied seed (more than 85 tons) was distributed to farmers in the states of Baja California, Chihuahua, Guanajuato, Hidalgo, Nuevo León, Sinaloa and Sonora.

title: 30 CIMMYT advanced lines with high yield potential, good grain quality and disease resistance selected for national evaluation.
narrative: 30 CIMMYT advanced lines with high yield potential, good grain quality and disease resistance selected for INIFAP’s nation-wide wheat yield trials in Mexico.

title: Validation of RUMINANT model of enteric methane emissions
narrative: RUMINANT is a model that simulates the digestive and metabolic processes of ruminant livestock. Based on the characteristics of the animal and the quality of the feed available (which must be entered by the model user), RUMINANT models nutritional needs and fermentation kinetics and estimates potential consumption, production of milk and meat, manure, excretion of nitrogen, and methane emissions.

title: Local Technical Agroclimatic Committees (LTACs) approach generating climate forecasts and crop response
narrative: The LTAC approach generates weather and climate-forecasts and likely crop response considering such forecast. These forecasts are tailored to local conditions and needs. The forecasts, produced by local agricultural sector institutions and technicians, are used as an input for monthly meetings, where growers and key-stakeholders discuss and analyze such information supporting the decision-making process. LTAC basic premise is that knowledge-intensive practices require learning through interaction and shared understandings, rather than through one-way directed knowledge transfer.

title: Implementation of a test to analyze PPO activity (PPO activity controls the darkening of flours and wheat products)
narrative: A new high throughput, low cost method, to analyze PPO activity was tested and implemented in the lab. In 2018, all BW lines from breeding program were analyzed for this important trait and selection for it can be done by the breeders.

title: foresight into changing consumption patterns and implications for research
narrative:
The foresight, ex-ante impact assessment and targeting team conducts research into changing diets and food systems in order to inform CIMMYTs technology development research.  key findings of this research related to South Asia were published
Mottaleb, et al. 2018. Changing Food Consumption of Households in Developing Countries: A Bangladesh Case. . DOI: 10.1080/08974438.2017.1402727 and Mottaleb, et al. 2018. Evolving food consumption patterns of rural and urban households in developing countries: A Bangladesh case DOI: 10.1108/BFJ-12-2016-0620

title: Tool to integrate and measure gender equality in monitoring and evaluation of climate services
narrative: This tool identifies key lessons learned on gender-aware M&E as well as methods to measure empowerment, including use of mixed methods and participatory tools, and gender-aware interview practices. It identifies the data that represent key factors underlying gender inequalities in access and use of weather and climate information and the dataset required to assess participation in agricultural decision-making. Sample quantitative and qualitative questions for collection of the datasets are provided.

title: Climate Smart Agriculture investment plans
narrative: Working closely with the World Bank the Adaptation of African Agriculture Initiative and country partners, this project developed a novel approach for creating CSA Investment Plans at the national level. This innovative approach is based on a foundation of strong stakeholder engagement, combining policy/literature review, key informant interviews, climate risk modeling, foresight analysis, Bayesian cost-benefit analysis, among other approaches to develop a CSA investment plan

title: Educator incentive system reduces dropout rates in primary school in Uganda
narrative: Teachers responded to this Pay for Percentile incentive system in ways that raised attendance rates two school years later from .56 to .60. These attendance gains were driven primarily by outcomes in treatment schools that provide textbooks for grade six math students. We document several results that are consistent with the hypothesis that teacher effort and books are complementary to achieve good education outcomes.

title: Understanding the impacts of the Yemen Social Fund for Development Cash for Nutrition program on child nutrition and health
narrative: The impact evaluation found that cash transfers with soft conditionality on attending nutritional training sessions increased child and maternal dietary diversity, maternal knowledge of recommended infant and young child feeding practices, rate of exclusive breastfeeding and early initiation of breastfeeding, treatment of water, and weight-for-height and height-for-age for chilren in the poorest tercile of treated households, whereas they decreased the rate of children being identified as malnourished.

title: Estimating minimum nutrient (N,P,K) requirements for climate-smart intensification of maize cropping
narrative: Building upon the innovation of 2017 for minimum N requirements, we now extended the approach to minimum N, P and K requirements for defined target yields of maize crops. Results are publicly available on www.yieldgap.org and methods and applications have been published (Global Food Security). Both IFA and Yara are very positive about this innovation and use it in their work in SSA to define nutrient requirements for climate-smart intensification. See Evidence and Outcome.

title: Framework of analysis of country-level mitigation potential from agricultural sector
narrative:
We developed a generalizable analytical framework for determining country-level mitigation potential from agricultural sector. Used this framework in India to determine country-level mitigation potential together with its spatial distribution using a bottom-up approach. 
We are using the same framework to analyze mitigation potential from agricultural sector in Bangladesh and Mexico in 2019.

title: Valuation of the general public's willingness to pay for the ecosystem services generated by on farm conservation of quinoa agrobiodiversity
narrative: A choice experiment survey tool explored the extent to which the public is willing to compensate producers for providing ecosystem services by maintaining quinoa agrobiodiversity on farm. For a quinoa conservation program, the willingness to pay was USD 31.79 per respondent, totaling $5.89 million per year - higher than conservation costs ($1.08 million per year). The findings will be used to justify allocation of public funds to conservation of crop genetic resource diversity.

title: Community seedbanks as platforms for building socio-ecological resilience
narrative: Studies in Guatemala and Nepal showed that the benefits of community seedbanks go beyond seed conservation. Community seedbanks were found to strengthen seed exchanges and contribute to broadening the agrobiodiversity base, allowing to test new varieties and recover local varieties that had disappeared from the community. These changes contribute to socio-ecological resilience.

title: Multistakeholder dialogue tool for cross-border integrated landscape management
narrative: Conflicts over natural resource management intertwined with insecurity and lack of capacity make it difficult for local governments at the border between Kenya and Somalia to engage in a constructive dialogue. The multistakeholder dialogue tool provides a platform for exchange of information between stakeholders, with the aim of conserving biodiversity resources in the Tana-Kipini-Badana bushland and seascapes of Kenya and Somalia.

title: Hybrids offcially released/registered for commecialization
narrative: Out of total 68 hybrids (derived_from_following_lines: CIM17MHS02 , CIM17MHS16,_CAH1418, S99TLYQ-B, Across_9331 RE, Across 9942 x Across 9944) licenced_to the_partners, nine_hybrids released; a total 73.7 tons_of_certified_seed was produced. This includes two_hybrids released by BARI, Bangladesh sublicensed to BRAC, two hybrids released by NMRP, Nepal and sublicensed to two_seed companies (SEAN & GATE, Nepal), one_hybrid released by UAS, Raichur & sublicensed to_MAHYCO, India and one hybrid each commercialized by_BAU, Sabor,_Lall Seeds, Srimad Seeds and Kumar Bioseed, India.

title: Environmental suitability maps for Ethiopian sheep and goat
narrative: These maps will allow to disseminate improved small ruminant genotypes (outputs from small ruminant community based breeding programmes) in relevant agro-ecologies.

title: Three CIMMYT Maize Lines (CML) released
narrative: Three stress-resilient CIMMYT Maize Lines (CML), including CML578, CML-579 and CML-580 globally released as international public good, and available from gene back of CIMMYT for use in maize breeding programs in tropics.

title: Field manual for drought phenotyping
narrative: A protocol for quantitative management of drought stress in field phenotyping developed and published.

title: Sanility tolerant hybrids
narrative: A set of five promising salinity tolerant hybrids identified, and taken forward for large-scale on-farm testing by partners in Bangladesh (BARI and BRAC) in salt-affected areas in South Bangladesh.

title: Stakeholders Prioritization Framework of Climate-Smart Agriculture Interventions
Protocol for characterizing community-based rangeland management cases
narrative: This is research protocol for comparative case study analysis of instances of institutional support for communities establishing community-based rangeland management.  It adopts an Option by Context approach, guiding the structured collection of variables on (a) the "option" (strategy and approach used by a change agent in terms of governance model/institutional structure), (b) the social and biophysical context, and (c) the outcomes.

title: Picture-based insurance: delivering affordable crop insurance using farmers' smartphone pictures to assess crop damage
narrative: Farmers register each site to be insured through an initial picture taken via a smartphone App. They take follow-up pictures to trigger personalized advisories, monitor crop health, and document losses. When assessing claims, experts evaluate the damage using the pictures. The pictures are geotagged and time-stamped, and the App has built-in features to prevent tampering with pictures. As more training data become available, machine learning is used to build automated image-processing algorithms.

title: Method to help countries define their trade liberalization strategies
narrative: Implementation of the African Continental Free Trade Agreement leads to challenges for African countries. Although most products have to be included in the trade liberalization scheme, each country may select “sensitive products” which will be exempt from this scheme. To help countries make this strategic decision, PIM has developed a method now used by various organizations including the United Nations Economic Commission for Africa to provide assistance to individual countries in the trade liberalization process.

title: Findings on the effects of combining lump sum cash transfers with technical and farm management advice to increase productivity and link farmers to value chains
narrative: A pilot project modeled after a Brazilian government-run program (Fomento) was implemented and evaluated with partners in Malawi and Senegal. The program combined extension advice and a lump sum payment, to better enable farmers to make investments which would allow them to participate in value chains (groundnut in Senegal and soybean in Malawi). In both countries, impacts on productivity measures were observed by the end of the project; the studies are being finalized.

title: The CCAFS Regional Agricultural Forecasting Tool (CRAFT) will help bring powerful advance information tools to farmers and agricultural decision makers, better allowing them to manage within-season climate risk to agriculture
narrative: CRAFT is a publicly accessible Windows desktop application that supports multiple crop models and can produce multiple simulation scenarios, maps, and interactive visualizations for regional crop yield forecasting, climate change and risk assessment. CRAFT can assess future climate risk for crop production and determines high climate-risk areas for crop yield. It can help a diverse range of stakeholders by providing reliable information on in-season yield forecasting and spatial and temporal variability of crop production.
evidence_link: CRAFT is available at: https://dssat.net/2919; see also https://doi.org/10.1016/j.envsoft.2019.02.006

title: Gender-sensitive LINK methodology for making business models more gender inclusive
narrative: The LINK methodology provides a process and tools for making business models more inclusive. The gender-sensitive LINK methodology provides tools for assessing and improving inclusion from a gender perspective.

title: Measurement, Reporting and Verification (MRV) Platform for Agriculture
narrative:
The MRV Platform for Agriculture contains tools, approaches, and case studies for MRV of GHG emissions and mitigation actions in the agriculture sector. The platform initially focuses on MRV resources specific to livestock, but will accommodate MRV for other agricultural sectors and cross-cutting issues over time.

This platform provide useful information to guide the technical and institutional design of MRV systems for agricultural mitigation actions, including those outlined in NDCs, NAMAs, and AFOLU projects.

title: Innovative use of sheep and goats by women in climate smart villages in Kenya
narrative: The CGIAR led project thus introduced improved strains of resilient but more productive indigenous breeds of Gala goats and Red Maasai sheep for crossbreeding with the local breeds and has resulted in women taking a lead in community led breeding programmes resulting in crosses with better performance and desirable traits.

title: "Agroclimatic similarity" variable developed to improve the measurement of the spatial spillover potential of agricultural R&D investments
narrative: A novel variable, the agroclimatic similarity between the locations of plant breeding institutes and the locations of the farms that adopt the improved technologies developed in these institutes, is introduced as a key factor affecting the spatial variations of agricultural productivity potential and agricultural transformation patterns. This approach provides a useful indicator of spatial variations in spillover potentials of agricultural technologies developed through public investments.

title: Rural Investment and Policy Analysis model
narrative: The Rural Investment and Policy Analysis model (RIAPA) is an economywide model that evaluates alternative policy and investment options based on their impacts on economic growth, job creation, poverty reduction, and dietary change. RIAPA captures farm and non farm components of the agri-food system, and links producers and consumers in rural and urban areas.

title: Value chain nominal rate of protection methodology
narrative: The nominal rate of protection methodology was extended to a value chain framework. The proposed indicator, value chain nominal rate of protection, allows policy makers to see an aggregate measure of policy impacts on all the commodities and products in the value chain, normalized at the farm level. The methodology was applied to selected value chains in India.

title: Intercropping with green manure cover crops (GMCC)
narrative: We tried Intercropping with green manure cover crops-GMCC inter cropping strategies with 7 different legume combinations in maize-based systems. These have been successful in Murehwa District

title: Methodology for identifying diversification options for climate change adaptation
narrative: TBA

title: Agrobiodiversity Index
narrative: The Agrobiodiversity Index is the tool we need to measure agrobiodiversity and identify concrete actions to achieve diverse and sustainable food systems. It will contribute to sustainability through three pillars: diets and markets, production systems and genetic resources. The Agrobiodiversity Index will help decision-makers – governments, investors and companies – ensure that food systems are more diverse and sustainable

title: Incorporating Genome-wide Association Mapping Results into Genomic Prediction Models for Grain Yield and Yield Stability in CIMMYT Spring Bread Wheat
narrative: The first time in wheat that GWAS results were incorporated into GS prediction models

title: Application freely available to farmers which provides crop recommendation
narrative: Project using satellite data to help Mexican smallholder farmers grow sugar cane and wheat with optimized crop productivity by identifying factors that cause the yield gap between crop potential and actual field performance. Mobile application aimed at helping Mexican farmers improve crop productivity and stabilize their incomes

title: Pronosticos AClimateColombia: A system for the sustainable provision of agro-climatic information for agricultural adaptation in Colombia
narrative: A digital agro-climatic forecast system for the provision of climate services in Colombia. The system, named “Pronosticos AClimateColombia”, formalizes the processing of climate and crop information from quality control, forecasting, and tailoring to crop-specific decision making processes. The design, development and evaluation process captured user needs by involving key stakeholders ranging from the Ministry of Agriculture, the National Meteorological Service (IDEAM), as well as farmer organizations and farmers in a range of agricultural areas.

title: Methodology for profiling indigenous food systems (elements, sustainability and resilience)
narrative: A participatory approach to characterize and assess resilience of Indigenous Food Systems to strengthen local capacities and inform global debates on sustainability. The main aim of the method is to document the inputs and outputs of the food system, links to the market, and indigenous practices and knowledge that support resilience and sustainability.

title: E-learning course on Mainstreaming Biodiversity for Food and Nutrition (available in English, Portuguese and Turkish)
Biodiversity Mainstreaming for Healthy and Sustainable Food Systems - A toolkit
narrative: This is an open-access guide to mainstreaming biodiversity that draws on case studies across the four partner countries, Brazil, Kenya, Sri Lanka and Turkey, outlining steps to provide evidence, influence policies, and raise awareness.

title: Using data from the Living Standards Measurement Study (LSMS), (non-food consumption data) to assess dietary intake and monitor dietary changes
narrative: Using LSMS (non-food consumption data) to assess dietary intake and monitoring dietary changes

title: Food system assessment in local settings (transects, food flow in Ethiopia, etc)
narrative: CIAT and WUR contribution to this Innovation (Stef de Haan (transect); Inge Brouwer (Food flow); Marrit vd Berg (food environment)"
evidence_link: Food flow: no open access. Zarifopolou A, Peletier J. Follow the food: Mapping food system dynamics in a rural-urban gradient in Southern Ethiopia. MSc Report, Wageningen University, Wageningen, 2018

title: Nutrition incentive in dairy contract farming in Northern Senegal
narrative: A nutrition incentive (micro-nutrient fortified yogurt) was introduced in the contract between semi-nomadic milk suppliers and a dairy processing factory in Northern Senegal in order to improve the regularity of milk delivery while also improving child nutrition. The study showed that the introduction of this incentive led to significant increases in the frequency of milk delivery but had limited impacts on total volume of milk delivered.

title: Methodology for dietary gap analysis at national level
narrative: Methodology to analyse dietary gaps at national level using non-food consumption data, using four different indicators: household dietary diversity score, Dietary Approaches to Stop Hypertension (DASH) diet score, Global Burden of Disease score and nutrient gap.

title: Methodology to analyse national food systems based on secondary reports and data: applied in Ethiopia
narrative:
Using a participatory process, stakeholders and researchers identify research streams to support the operationalizing of food systems
approaches in Ethiopia. The published product provides a summary review of the literature, applies a food systems framework to research priorities in the Ethiopian context, develops an initial food systems profile of Ethiopia, and identifies 25 priority research questions, categorized into three main areas.

title: Development of the process and methodology to assess drivers of vegetables intake
narrative: This study aimed to provide insights into vegetable consumption behavior of urban Nigerian consumers across different Socio-Economic Classes (SEC), their main food choice motives, and the associations of these motives and other drivers with vegetable consumption.

title: Methodology to analysis highly informal dairy markets and its consumers
narrative: With the need for high quality, unbiased, consumer market data and the latest on-the-ground information, Euromonitor collaboration GAIN embarked on  methodology developmentto collect robust, standardised market data to be used to monitor health intervention strategies, improve consumer health and support SMEs in the supply chain. The methodology is applied to the dairy sector in Ethiopia, to identify dairy products typically consumed and point of purchased, size the dairy market and understanding of the brands available.
evidence_link: no evidence yet, methodology is under embargo untill fully tested

title: Protocol to assess and reduce post-harvest losses in tomato value chain
narrative: The framework highlights the interconnected nature of problems the supply chain and the need to look at the whole system instead of specific stages, when proposing solutions. Practices and underlying causes contributing to food loss are identified for each stage of the supply chain using a literature search. Deductive logic is used to fill the gaps where literature was found to be scarce, and to derive socioeconomic indicators that signal the presence of identified causes.

title: Tool (crates) to reduce post-harvest losses for tomatoes
narrative: Testing out methodology to reduce food waste by the use of plastic crates in stead of woven baskets in the tomato market in Nigeria

title: Veggies on Wheels intervention for urban consumers in Nigeria
narrative: The veg-on-wheels intervention offered fresh and ready-to-cook vegetables to urban Nigerian consumers. The ready-to-cook green leafy vegetables were sold in cool boxes on bikes and push carts. This way the vegetables could stay fresh and could be sold at convenient locations close to work places.

title: Methdology for stakeholder-led identification of platforms for healthier diets and the role of platforms as mechanisms to support the scaling and anchoring of food system transformations for healthier diets
narrative: Inclusive and sustainable food systems should guarantee consumers availability of, equitable access to and efficient delivery of safe and healthy food. This requires active networking between multiple stakeholders, engaged in different parts of the food system. This methodology uses network analysis to visualise relevant platforms, clustering organisations and identifying key connectors (multiple memberships).

title: Women's Empowerment in Agriculture Index for Value chains (WEAI4VC)
narrative: The first pilot assessed empowerment of men and women as different types of value chain actors (producers, entrepreneurs, and wage workers) in Bangladesh. A second pilot in the Philippines looked at empowerment of men and women working in production, processing, trading, and marketing in abaca, coconut, seaweed, and swine value chains. The third pilot in Honduras adapted the WEAI4VC questionnaires from the Philippines study to the context of cashew, fruits, and dairy value chains.

title: Vit A Maize: PVA SYN 6 F2
narrative: new biofortified variety of Vitamin A maize

title: Vit A Maize variety: PVA SYN 13 F2
narrative: new biofortified variety of vitamin A maize

title: Zinc Maize variety: BIO-MZn01
narrative: new biofortified variety of zinc maize

title: Iron Bean variety: NUA 99
narrative: new biofortified variety of iron bean

title: Zinc Maize variety: ICTA HB-18ACP+Zn
narrative: new biofortified variety of zinc maize

title: Zinc Maize variety: ICTA B-15ACP+Zn
narrative: new biofortified variety of zinc maize

title: Iron Pearl Millet variety: HHB 311 (MH 2179)
narrative: new biofortified variety of iron pearl millet

title: Iron Pearl Millet variety: RHB 234 (MH 2174)
narrative: new biofortified variety of iron pearl millet

title: Iron Pearl Millet variety: AHB 1269 (MH 2185)
narrative: new biofortified variety of iron pearl millet

title: Iron Pearl Millet variety: RHB 233 (MH 2173)
narrative: new biofortified variety of iron pearl millet

title: Vit A Maize variety: MH46A
narrative: new biofortified variety of vitamin A maize

title: Zinc Rice variety: INPARI IR Nutri Zinc
narrative: New biofortified variety of zinc rice

title: Vit A Maize variety: MH45A
narrative: new biofortified variety of vitamin A maize

title: Vit A Maize variety: MH47A
narrative: new biofortified variety of vitamin A maize

title: Vit A Maize variety: MH48A
narrative: new biofortified variety of vitamin A maize

title: Vit A Maize variety: MH49A
narrative: new biofortified variety of vitamin A maize

title: Zinc Wheat variety: Nohely F2018
narrative: new variety of biofortified zinc wheat

title: Zinc Maize variety: Fortinica
narrative: new biofortified variety of zinc maize

title: Zinc Maize variety: Nutre-Mas
narrative: new biofortified variety of zinc maize

title: Iron Pearl Millet variety: Chakti (ICTP 8203)
narrative: new biofortified variety of iron pearl millet

title: Iron Bean variety: Selian 14 (MAC 44)
narrative: new biofortified variety of iron bean

title: Iron Bean variety: Selian 15 (RWV 1129)
narrative: new biofortified variety of iron bean

title: Model to estimate the returns on investment of agricultural research investments
narrative: A modeling framework uses real-options-theory to incorporate alternative scenarios into estimates of the returns on investment of agricultural research investments.

title: Participatory Integrated Climate Services for Agriculture (PICSA)
narrative: PICSA is a participatory climate service extension process that combines historical climate data and forecasts with farmers’ knowledge, and uses participatory planning methods to help them make informed decisions about their agricultural practices

title: Information and Communications Technology (ICT)-based App—“YeZaRe”—for disseminating climate and market information to smallholder farmers developed and is being tested in northern and southern Ethiopian highlands through a public-private partnership
narrative: An ICT-based App—for providing weather forecasts, agro-advisory and market information to smallholder farmers developed and is being tested with smallholder Ethiopian farmers. Through a mobile App and SMS, location-specific weather forecasts bundled with market prices is disseminated to inform farmer decision-making. Weather information includes 3, 10, 30-days and seasonal forecast on rainfall onset and cessation. The 10-days forecast includes advisory service with specified management actions. Tailored agro-meteorological advisory allows informed decision-making that maximize agricultural productivity.

title: Adoption and testing of the Gold Standard Smallholder Dairy Methodology
narrative:
In cooperation with UN FAO and ILRI, a methodology for quantification of GHG emission reductions from smallholder dairy productivity improvements has been developed. The methodology was formally approved by the Gold Standard in November 2016. 
In 2018, the methodology was tested by the implementation of a baseline survey of 429 households in central Kenya. The survey collected data required for GHG estimation, data on adoption of management practices, sources of finance and gender roles.

title: Behavior change communication campaign on awareness and prevention of zoonoses, designed for health workers to deliver to patients
narrative: Public health campaign/materials designed for health care workers and their patients to raise awareness of zoonotic diseases and how to prevent them

title: Video clips on Rift Valley fever customised for dissemination using smart phones
narrative: https://ilvac.net/2018/06/22/introducing-english-and-swahili-instructional-videos-on-the-patterns-signs-symptoms-and-control-of-rift-valley-fever/

title: Artistic decoration for the general public illustrating the importance of genetic diversity
narrative: The innovation has several elements mural photographs, video and book of chicken genomes

title: Qualitative methodological approach to better understand the socioeconomic factors that influence adoption of Climate-Smart Agricultural options in smallholder farming communities.
narrative: Development and piloting of a qualitative methodological three-step methodology aiming to answer: (1) Which CSA options promoted by CCAFS have been adopted by farmers? (2) Who within the community is adopting which CSA option(s)? What is the diversity in the types of farmers according to their CSA adoption profile? (3) What are the motivations and enabling/constraining factors for each farmer type to adopt a CSA option?

title: Climate Smart Agriculture (CSA) monitoring framework to track adoption, outcomes, synergies and tradeoffs at household and farm level
narrative: The proposed integrated CSA framework is made of a set of 44 standard indicators (across the three CSA pillars) and a user friendly ICT-based data collection App, allowing to systematically i) assess adoption trends, motivations and constraining factors (community level), and ii) generate new evidence-based knowledge on location-specific perceived effects of CSA options at farm and household levels.

title: Updated social accounting matrix for the Sudan
narrative: The 2012 social accounting matrix (SAM) for the Sudan has a special focus on agriculture, water, and energy.

title: (Arab) Agricultural Investment for Development Analyzer
narrative: The (Arab) Agricultural Investment for Development Analyzer (AIDA) is an agricultural and rural economic planning toolkit designed to help governments and analysts draw agricultural investment plans and ensure that levels of investment in the agricultural and rural sectors is sufficient for achieving the desired outcomes. AIDA has been built using an economywide and minimalistic investment data approach.

title: Tools for the USAID Global Food Security Strategy transition framework
narrative: The USAID Global Food Security Strategy (GFSS) transition framework is used to monitor country progress towards an end state where they can transition out of GFSS target country status.  PIM developed 1) a tool which aggregates into three composite dimensions (level of need, commitment to food security, and country capacity) the data on the indicators used to monitor country progress, and 2) a scorecard approach to visually represent country progress.

title: New economic growth model that includes the informal sector
narrative: The Lewis dual-sector model was adapted to include the "in-between" sector (micro, small and medium enterprises in the informal economy). The model provide a partial explanation for recent patterns of growth in Rwanda where the in-between sector has expanded more rapidly than the tradable sector.

title: Investment pathways (Stepwise approach) tailored to specific farmer segments for improving resilience and smart agriculture practices
narrative: To support CSA recommendations, IITA developed investment pathways known as the Stepwise approach - which looked in more detail at which good agricultural practices need to be put into place for which typology of farmer to reach different degrees of productivity and profitability. We then went on to overlay the identified CSA recommendations with the IITA Stepwise investment pathway which resulted in the final list of CSA recommendations that have been clustered in 'packages'.

title: Developing, testing and making available an integrated climate and agro-climate advisory to enhance adaptive capacity and sustainable agricultural productivity in Ethiopia
narrative: This on-line tool aims to increase agricultural production and resilience to climate variability and change through effective integrated AgroClimate Advisory system to advise smallholder farmers, private sector, policy-makers, federal and state government, research and higher learning institutions in Ethiopia. The system architecture include systems layers and components that include forecast generators and apps, climate model that configures parameters of climate prediction for different agro-ecological zones and integrates contextualized crop models for key/major food crops.

title: Maize genotypes resistant to the devastating Corn Stunt Complex disease
narrative: We developed 100 inbred lines that carry resistance to  of Corn Stunt Complex (CSC) disease. CSC is a very important disease of maize in many Latin American Countries and can cause close to 100% yield losses in susceptible maize plants during severe epidemics.

title: Biological control product for controlling aflatoxin contamination in maize grain
narrative: We are in the process of development of biological control methods of controlling aflatoxin contamination in maize grain. These are certain bacterial strains that reduce the development of of some fungal species that produce substances (secondary metabolites) that are very toxic to humans and animals. Aflatoxin contamination of food is especially important in developing countries. Our preliminary results are very promising and we need to repeat the experiment one more year to prove the concept.

title: Updated Tropical Forages Tool (formerly known as SoFT)
narrative: The Tropical Forages tool is currently being updated in terms of content and technical features. The content was updated to the status quo of actual research and new technical features include e.g. a mobile app and automatic translation through google translator.

title: New Brachiaria hybrid "Camello"
narrative: 1 new Brachiaria hybrid (Camello) available for uptake

title: Commercialization of CIAT's Urochloa hybrids (e.g. Mulato II, Cayman, Cobra) through private sector partner
narrative: CIAT's Urochloa hybrids are being scaled by the private sector partner on >930,000 hectares in >15 countries by 2018

title: Gendered Feed Assessment Tool (G-FEAST)
narrative: A gender-enhanced version of the Feed Assessment Tool (FEAST)

title: Early identification of haploid embryos in maize
narrative: Instead of relying on mature seeds to identify haploid seeds, we have developed a simple methodology to identify haploids from immature embryos just two weeks after pollination, saving months worth of time.  We have also developed methodology to double the chromosome number before germinating the embryos.  The technology is very simple and can be adapted anywhere with minimal equipment.

title: Fine mapping of resistance against maize lethal necrosis (MLN)
narrative: Using a mix of commercially available and proprietary molecular markers, Corteva Agriscience, our collaborator, has helped map the causal gene in a little less than two years.  We are down to a single polymorphism as a strong candidate, which is being currently edited in susceptible lines to make them resistant to MLN.

title: Mobile Near Infrared Spectroscopy (NIRS) using improved algorithms
narrative: Mobile, handheld and affordable NIRS tested against stationary NIRS and conventional analysis

title: Low-infrastructure artificial insemination laboratory "mobile kit" (part of reproductive platform to support and scale goat breeding programs in Ethiopia and Tanzania)
narrative: The innovation is a low-infrastructure artificial insemination laboratory "mobile kit" which can be easily transferred to, installed in and used under full field conditions.

title: New Urochloa interspecific hybrids
narrative: Formation and testing of new Urochloa interspecific hybrids, better in at least one marked desired trait than current commercial hybrids benchmarks.

title: New Urochloa humidicola hybrids
narrative: Formation and testing of Urochloa humidicola hybrids, better in at least one marked desired trait than current commercial germplasm benchmarks (Currently, no hybrids have reached the market from any breeding program).

title: New Megathyrsus hybrids
narrative: Most Megathyrsus maximus accessions are characterized by high biomass and excellent nutritional quality, but they fail in the adaptation to limiting conditions, which makes them only suitable for high input agriculture. We are investing all our efforts to evolve new hybrids more rustic that can easily adapt to the conditions of low input agriculture, while maintaining their performance in terms of Biomass production and nutritional quality.

title: New groundnut dual purpose cultivars for India
narrative: Cultivars that are superior in food and fodder traits

title: New maize dual purpose cultivars
narrative: Cultivars that are superior in food and fodder traits

title: Definition of cost-effective total mixed rations for dairy cattle in India
narrative: Definition of cost-effective total mixed rations (based on cereal crop residues, bran and oil cakes) for dairy cattle at sub-national level in India (Tumkur, Karnataka and Yavatmal, Maharashtra).

title: International Model for Policy Analysis of Agricultural Commodities and Trade (IMPACT) webtool
narrative: Tool hosted on the IFPRI Food Security portal presenting various results from the IMPACT model and based on different studies and reports for the Global Food Security Report.

title: Improvement of wheat landraces, collected from farmers, through evaluation and selection.
narrative: The landraces were collected form the farmers. Since mots of them are mixtures - they went through analytical selection in 3-4 years and evaluation to identify the best components of the landrace and re-create the population to be provided back to farmer.

title: Development and utilization of primary winter synthetics to incorporate important new traits in winter wheat varieties.
narrative: New synthetic winter wheat varieties were developed using winter durums from Ukraine and Romania and Ae. taushii. The new synthetic wheat contained important sources of resistance to diseases such as rusts. They also demonstrated strong grain mineral content and drought tolerance. The innovation is the techniques used.

title: Elite winter wheat lines.
narrative: New winter and facultative wheat varieties developed by IWWIP (Turkey-CIMMYT-ICARDA) for irrigated and semi-arid environments and it has been made available to public and private breeding and research programs globally.

title: Village Seed Banks have been developed through this project, playing a vital role in varietal turnover.
narrative: The project has supported the development of local seed system, through farmer owned seed business. These businesses are critical for ensuring old varieties are replaced with the improved varieties containing the traits necessary for the areas in question. The banks sell quality wheat seed for up to 12 percent less than local markets

title: Options for keeping the food system within environmental limits
narrative: We show that between 2010 and 2050, as a result of expected changes in population and income levels, the environmental effects of the food system could increase by 50–90% in the absence of technological changes and dedicated mitigation measures, reaching levels that are beyond safe planetary boundaries. We find that a synergistic combination of measures (dietary changes, improvements in technologies/management, reductions in food losses) are needed to sufficiently mitigate the projected increase in environmental pressures.

title: New maize breeding objectives based on a comprehensive understanding of users’ preferences for maize products in Africa
narrative: This research studied the most important maize-based foods in Africa and their respective traditional processing techniques, assessed maize preferences, analysed physical and chemical characteristics of maize, estimated the contribution of maize to the daily diet of Africans, assessed the impact of traditional processing on nutritional composition of maize, and, lastly, formulated crucial breeding objectives to meet users’ preferences.

title: New rice dual purpose cultivars
narrative: Cultivars that are superior in food and fodder traits

title: Potential benefits of drought and heat tolerance for adapting maize to climate change in tropical environments
Determinants of maize cultivation in a land-scarce rice-based economy in Bangladesh
narrative: Maize (Zea mays L.) use, mostly as poultry and fish feed, has been increasing rapidly in Bangladesh – a densely populated country with a rice-based agri-food system. Domestic maize production has increased despite land scarcity but failed to meet the growing demand, with imports making up the shortfall. The present study contextualizes Bangladesh’s domestic maize production potential and examines the determinants of current maize cultivation using data from 1.12 million farm households.

title: Lesson: Recommended for Data Dimensionality reduction for Adoption Impact Assessment and targeting.
Poverty sensitive scorecard tool: combining risk scoring with poverty scoring to help lenders and policy makers prioritize development projects
narrative: This scorecard tool contains two innovations. 1) The risk-scoring algorithm is built on the latest developments in statistical modeling, which improves the accuracy of the risk assessments. 2) By combining risk scoring and poverty scoring, the instrument goes beyond standard poverty-targeting approaches to prioritize lending or grant allocation: it ranks projects that target the poor AND are sustainable.

title: Analytical approach for predicting potential areas of agroforestry expansion
narrative: CCAFS/ICRAF developed an analytical approach based on expansion domains. These domains establish the suitable areas based on both biophysical and socioeconomic characteristics for agroforestry species and systems. This provides a realistic picture of where it will be possible to use agroforestry and where it will not. The analytical framework also estimates the costs of implementation for each agroforestry system based on secondary data that ICRAF compiled in its Viet Nam Agroforestry Database.

title: New Varieties adopted: Mayi Plus 1
narrative: CIMMYT maize yield trials have identified two varieties that out-yield anything grown in Haiti in both irrigated and rain-fed conditions.  Basically, CIMMYT has identified the best varieties for the next decade in Haiti.

title: Understanding the effects of emergency school feeding and general food distribution on children's schooling in conflict areas
narrative: Using data from a unique pre-crisis baseline and five-year follow-up, the study investigated effects of emergency school feeding and general food distribution on children’s schooling during conflict in Mali. Both methods of food assistance had different effects on outcomes, emphasizing the need for joint programming between humanitarian responses and education in conflict areas. The educational implications of food assistance should be considered in planning humanitarian responses to bridge the gap between emergency assistance and development.

title: Understanding the impacts of the World Food Programme's food assistance on food consumption and child nutrition in conflict-affected areas
narrative: The effects of food assistance on children’s height and caloric and micro-nutrient consumption were concentrated in areas not in the immediate vicinity of the conflict, while an increase in household food expenditures was observed closed to the location of armed groups. The effects of food assistance were higher for households receiving at least two forms of food assistance.

title: Nutrition-sensitive social protection interventions increase the use of multiple-micronutrient powders and iron supplements in rural preschool Bangladeshi children
narrative: Cash/food transfers accompanied by nutrition counseling increased the likelihood that children aged 6-59 months had ever consumed multiple-micronutrient powders, had consumed multiple-micronutrient powders in the preceding week, and had consumed either multiple-micronutrient powders or an iron supplement in the preceding week. The combination of transfers and nutrition counseling also increased maternal knowledge of iron deficiency and awareness of multiple-micronutrient powders. These Impacts differed from those of transfers alone, highlighting the importance of complementary nutrition counseling.

title: Scaling conservation agriculture-based sustainable intensification systems in Ethiopia
narrative: Several activities have been conducted on identifying, synthesizing and mapping sustainable maize production systems in Africa since 2012.  Research evidences on sustainable production systems (improved variety targeting combined with conservation agriculture) were synthesized and a policy engagement works done over two years resulted in adoption of conservation agriculture -based sustainable intensification by the Ministry of Agriculture of Ethiopia.

title: Use of high-throughput color sorting technology to enrich source breeding populations for deep orange color required for maize varieties containing high pro-vitamin A content.
narrative: In breeding populations targeting increased pro-vitamin A, the product profile includes a recognizable deep orange color.  We plan to use high-throughput optical sorting technology to enable us to rapidly screen very large populations of seeds to sub-set the most orange kernels for further breeding work.

title: Seed Production Technology
narrative: Seed Production Technology (SPT) system prevents specific plants from producing pollen.  The system enables production of non-pollen producing early generation seed (EGS) which is non GM.  SPT produced EGS results in cost savings to seed companies, improves the hybrid purity of commercial seed, and results in a hybrid product which has 50% non pollen producing plants and 4 to 5% increased grain yield under farmer conditions.

title: Ex-ante analysis to determine potential benefits from BNI-technology
narrative:
Incorporating Biological Nitrification Inhibition into crops offers the potential of simultaneously increasing Nitrogen use efficiency and reducing nitrous-oxide emissions into the atmosphere and thus reducing the greenhouse gas emission  footprint of agricultural production systems.
BNI will potentially be available in crop varieties for farmers in 12 to 25 years from now. Time-frame depends on crop, the environment, management options and the broad socio-economic context, requiring both foresight and ex-ante impact assessment.

title: ex-ante impact assessment of wheat blast in south Asia
narrative: A spatial mapping and ex ante study regarding the risk and potential spread in South Asia of wheat blast, a mysterious and deadly disease from the Americas that unexpectedly infected wheat in southwestern Bangladesh in 2016, identified 7 million hectares of wheat cropping areas in Bangladesh, India, and Pakistan whose agro-climatic conditions resemble those of the Bangladesh outbreak zone.

title: Fluctuating milling quality in wheat: The Achilles Heel of Cereal Foresight Studies?
narrative: One of the expected consequences of climate change is the occurrence of more erratic rainfall patterns. This implies that there will always be production areas that will be confronted with weather conditions that are not conducive to high levels of wheat grain quality (milling quality, processing and end-use quality). The question is, if fluctuating grain quality, matters in the long-run for food security and, if fluctuating wheat grain quality could spark a food crisis.

title: Methodology for using GIS in chicken breeds suitability map in Ethiopia
narrative: Methodology for assessing the productivity of improved chicken genotypes in different agro-ecologies (on-station)

title: A panel of single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) for genomic imputation and admixture proportion analysis in East African dairy crossbreed breeds
narrative: Cost-effective high-density (HD) genotypes of livestock species can be obtained by genotyping a proportion of the population using a HD panel and the remainder using a cheaper low-density panel, and then imputing the missing genotypes that are not directly assayed in the low-density panel.

title: Feeding cassava leaves to livestock for reducing methane emissions
narrative: Through an in-vitro experiment we demonstrated the potential of cattle diets with cassava supplements to reduce methane emissions.  The practice of feeding cassava leaves to livestock is common during the dry season (when feed availability is low) among livestock farmers in northern Colombia. Our work demonstrated that supplementing livestock feed with cassava leaves may contribute towards reductions in enteric methane emissions.

title: Precision fertilizer application for smallholders
narrative: Precision nutrient management to increase efficiency and reduce drudgery. Development of localized versions of the ‘Crop Manager’ decision-making tool to provide location-specific fertilizer recommendations for farmers growing rice and maize in Odisha, and rice-wheat and maize in Eastern Uttar Pradesh and Bihar.

title: Laser land leveling
narrative: Machinery and service provision models for Laser Land Leveling to increase water and energy productivity
evidence_link: Details are available in annual reports found here: https://csisa.org/annual-reports/; https://csisa.org/research-notes/

title: Integrated weed management (IWM)
narrative: IWM complex weed flora in rice, maize, and wheat

title: Yield potential estimation for variable fertilizer rate adjustments
narrative: Several on-farm and on-station experiments conducted in collaboration with the National Wheat Research Program and farmers’ groups for different production environments showed that wheat yields can be doubled through balanced fertilizer application.

title: Precision crop establishment methods for wheat and rice
narrative:
Risk-reducing agronomy for directly-sown rice (2); NP, BD

Zero tillage wheat to boost productivity and profitability while reducing environmental impacts of production in South Asia (4); NP

Mechanical transplanting for rice (3); NP

Healthy rice seedings (4); NP, BD

Early planting of long-duration wheat varieties for resilience and yield optimization (3); NP, BD

Decision rules for timely rice transplanting and irrigation management (1); NP, BD

title: Multiple disease management innovations for maize and wheat
narrative:
Integrated management of fungal diseases in lentil through agro-climatology and effective fungicides (2); NP, BD

Integrated management of stalk rot in maize (1); NP

Dry chain management for reducing aflatoxin in maize (1); NP

Safe planting windows to avoid wheat blast (2); BD

Climate services for disease prediction and management (2); NP, BD (note: includes lentil and wheat)

Fungicides for wheat blast (4); BD

title: Scale-appropriate mechanization innovations in maize and wheat systems
narrative:
Multi-crop planters for the 2-wheel tractor (3); NP

Scale-appropriate reaper technologies to address labour bottlenecks at harvest (4); NP, BD

Low-cost solar pumps for field crops (2); NP

Axial flow pump (4); BD
evidence_link: Details are available in annual reports found here: https://csisa.org/annual-reports/

title: Precision fertilizer broadcasting for increasing efficiency and reducing drudgery
narrative: Prime Minister’s Agriculture Modernization Project (PMAMP) units and District Agriculture Development Offices in the Terai have included the precision spreader in their machinery subsidy programs, allowing farmers to procure the equipment at a reduced price from local suppliers.

title: Harnessing Ethiopian floodwaters helps dryland pastoralists – and the approach is scaling up
narrative: There is now an increased interest by other donors to do the same in flood-prone areas in Ethiopia and beyond. Remote sensing tools used to identify flood-based spots for producing feed and food in about 1.2 million ha of land in Afar., which  is now attracting  investment in Afar, Ethiopia.

title: Mini-tillers for cropping systems productivity in Nepal
narrative: The mini tiller is a low-cost option for rural traction has been implemented and used through a group-based service provision model to recoup costs and share the technology across the village

title: Course for Cambodian parliament on climate politics
narrative: In 2018, a 10 month program was organized for the members of the Cambodian Senate and the Parliamentary Institute of Cambodia on climate change, climate politics and climate negotiations. The course was successfully implemented and led, among other things, to a Brief to the Senate by the President of the Senate on climate change, agriculture and food security.

title: Social learning approaches in Climate Smart Villages (CSV) development and scaling
narrative: These are the social processes that goes with CSA technologies and practices in developing climate smart villages(CSVs). Experiences in Vietnam & Philippines show the while CSA relevance differ from one site to another due to varying contexts, there is a set of common  systematic steps that fosters innovation, CSA knowledge generation & sharing among farmers. The social learning processes from both sites are: common-interest groups, participatory action researches, learning-sites/impact-areas, and on-site knowledge sharing events.

title: Dissemination of improved Bonga ram
narrative: Improved Bonga have now been disseminated throughout the SNNP

title: Climate tipping point game for Conference of the Parties (COP) delegates
narrative: Purdue University, Glasgow Caledonian and Utrecht University/CCAFS developed a game that simulates climate negotiations and their impacts on climate tipping points, which was played by COP and SBSTA delegates in 2018.

title: Evaluating farm agro-biodiversity using the Biodiversity Friend methodology
Solar Bubble dryer in Nepal
narrative: This is a low-cost drying technology option for solving the drying problems by providing a simple and flexible alternative to sun drying that offers protection of the grains from rain. It is also a climate smart technology as it does not require an external energy source

title: Solar Bubble Dryer version 2
narrative: This is a low-cost drying technology option for solving the drying problems by providing a simple and flexible alternative to sun drying that offers protection of the grains from rain. It is also a climate smart technology as it does not require an external energy source.

title: GrainSafe™ Dry hermetic rice storage system
narrative:
Hermetic	storage	systems	can	be	used	for	bag	storage	(Super	bags,	and	Cocoons™)	
or	for	small-scale bulk	storage	(GrainSafe™).		The	GrainSafe™	has	1t	capacity	and	
was	specifically	designed	for	safe	storage	at	village	level.

title: Super bag rice grain storage
narrative: Bags to hermetically and safely store rice grains after harvest by individual farmers

title: Flat bed dryer
narrative: Reversible airflow flatbed dryer with a capacity of 20 tons of paddy per batch

title: The Scaling Scan
narrative: The Scaling Scan helps an individual analyze, reflect on, and sharpen one’s scaling ambition and approach through a series of questions and prompts. It focuses on ten scaling ‘ingredients’ that need to be considered (e.g. knowledge and skills, public sector governance, awareness and demand) to reach the desired outcome.

title: The Scaling Scan
molecular purity test of seed
narrative: The method is based on preparation of a seed extract containing particular seed isoenzymes in a suitable extraction fluid and separation of the so extracted seed isoenzymes using isoelectric focusing at a suitable pH gradient formed by ampholytes, where after the so separated isoenzymes are conventionally colored and visually detected. The so obtained electrophoretic pattern is used to assess the genetic purity of maize hybrid varieties.

title: Implementation of the Seed Without Borders agreement
narrative: This policy allows countries to fast track the approval of new rice varieties for release based on variety release approval in other countries that joined the seed-without-borders treaty

title: Tool combining different methods to identify priority diseases in livestock systems
narrative: Tool combining different methods to identify priority diseases in livestock systems

title: Community conversation as a gender transformative approach in livestock health management
narrative: Community conversation is a capacity development tool to address gender inequalities related to livestock health management and risk of exposure to zoonoses. It uses interactive methods such as visual aids, role plays, and storytelling to start conversations and engage community members in dialogue.

title: Customized GS training set development
narrative: The method is designed to extract a subset of a large collection of lines with phenotype + genotype which have the most relevant information for predicting GEBVs of new lines without phenotype data.

title: High value markers linked to major gene for MLN tolerance in maize.
narrative: Markers in very close linkage with the major QTL for MLN tolerance from KS23 have been deployed and used successfully to improve breeding populations and convert susceptible lines to MLN tolerance.

title: RHoMIS – a rural household multiple indicator survey tool
narrative: RHoMIS was designed to improve the process of gathering information from farming households in the rural developing world. Household surveys are very widely carried out, but the data is rarely comparable, and so the opportunities for learning between individual projects are limited. For these reasons, the tool balances standardisation with flexibility.

title: Precision fertilizer application for smallholders
narrative:
Precision nutrient management to increase efficiency and reduce
drudgery

title: Integrated weed management (IWM) Integrated weed management (IWM)  complex weed flora in rice, maize, and wheat
narrative: IWM complex weed flora in rice, maize, and wheat
evidence_link: Details are available in annual reports found here: https://csisa.org/annual-reports/

title: Multiple disease management innovations
narrative:
Integrated management of fungal diseases in lentil through agro-climatology and effective fungicides (2); NP, BD Integrated management of stalk rot in maize (1);
NP Dry chain management for reducing aflatoxin in maize (1); NP Safe planting windows to avoid
wheat blast (2); BD Climate services for disease prediction and management (2); NP, BD (note: includes
lentil and wheat) Fungicides for wheat blast (4); BD

title: Scale-appropriate mechanization innovations (Multiple)
narrative:
Multi-crop planters for the 2-wheel tractor (3); NP Scale-appropriate
reaper technologies to address labour bottlenecks at harvest (4); NP, BD Low-cost solar pumps for
field crops (2); NP Axial flow pump (4); BD

title: Business models for three selected best-bet interventions for small ruminant value chains in Ethiopia
narrative: Business models were developed for three best-bet interventions, namely sheep fattening, ram selection and market information system. The best -bet interventions were identified, tested and recommended for selected small ruminant value chains in Ethiopia. The models provide initial ideas for interested businesses and researchers on the potential of the best-bets as business interventions in the sites for up to four years.

title: WABEF, a toolkit to promote anaerobic digestion of bio-wastes in West Africa
narrative: WABEF is a compendium of data sheets and databases (3) to estimate the wastes from agricultural activities, municipal activities, and ago-industrial activities. It suggests anaerobic digestion technologies to use up these bio-wastes. It uses a simulation model (Approzut and UPUTUC simulation) to compare the mass balances and assess the investment and operating costs of these technologies to support decision making by governments, communities, industries and farmers.

title: Nicaragua dairy systems dynamics model – public facing aspect
narrative: This project developed a quantitative model of the dairy value chain in the district of Matiguas in Nicaragua. Two particular innovations from this work were (1) the use of participatory group model building tools in developing/parameterizing this model with dairy value chain stakeholders and (2) hosting the parameterized model with a public interface online, allowing interested parties to conduct simulations under alternative technical parameter assumptions

title: "Reach, Benefit, Empower" framework of indicators for monitoring programs and policies
narrative:
"Johnson, N., M. Balagamwala, C. Pinkstaff, S. Theis, R. Meinzen-Dick, and A. Quisumbing.  2018.  How do agricultural development projects empower women? What hasn’t worked and what might.  Journal of Agriculture, Gender, and Food Security 3(2):1-19. http://agrigender.net/views/agricultural-development-projects-empowering-women-JGAFS-322018-1.php 

https://www.rural21.com/english/current-issue/detail/article/doing-things-differently-gender-transformative-skills-development-in-agriculture-00002938/ (GIZ’s use)

http://tropicallegumes.icrisat.org/misuse-of-the-term-empowerment-in-daily-conversations/ (blog post Brenda shared today)"

title: Involving the private sector to improve the multiplication and marketing of high quality seed: the Direct Seed Marketing program in Ethiopia
narrative: The evaluation compared the Direct Seed Marketing approach to the traditional government-managed system, and found that this system leads to positive outcomes. The study concluded that the increased engagement by private seed producers in the provision of improved seeds to Ethiopia's smallholder farmers is a useful and necessary element in the transformation of Ethiopia?s agricultural sector.

title: Zoonoses training manual for slaughterhouse workers
narrative: Booklets containing simple public health messages to reduce health risks for slaughterhouse workers and consumers.

title: Pen-side diagnostic assay for cysticercosis
narrative: A diagnostic tool farmers or meat inspectors could use to detect Taenia solium cyst infections (cysticercosis) in pigs to prevent entry of contaminated pork in the food chain.

title: [updated from 2017] Vicious Worm training app for cysticercosis control
narrative: Health-education tool ‘The Vicious Worm’ creates awareness and provides evidence-based health education as a specific measure in control strategies.

title: SMART-Valleys approach
narrative: Participatory approach to develop inland valleys (IVs) for rice-based systems with improved water management

title: RiceAdvice
narrative: Android based decision support tools for providing farmers with field-specific management guidelines for rice production systems in Africa

title: Two-row Motorized Paddy Weeder
narrative: Locally adopted two-row Motorized Paddy Weeder developed in collaboration with private fabricators. The weeder can be used in irrigated and rainfed lowland systems and can save labour for weeding up to 80%.

title: Seeder cum fertiliser micro-dose applicator (Fertiseeder)
narrative: A manual seeder cum fertilizer micro-dose applicator (Fertiseeder) developed to save labor in direct seeding and micro-dose placement.

title: Cropping calendar construction model
narrative: Excel-based decision support tool that can generate, compare and visualise opportunities for single/double/triple cropping systems consisting of irrigated rice and optionally a vegetable/legumes

title: Alternate wetting and drying (AWD) in Africa
narrative: Alternate wetting and drying is a water saving technology that enables irrigated rice cultivation with less water than the conventional practice of maintaining the field continuously flooded. Under AWD, ﬁelds are subjected to intermittent ﬂooding where irrigation is interrupted, and water is allowed to subside until the soil reaches a certain moisture level, after which the field is re-flooded. It has been reported that this technology can reduce water input and GHG without yield penalty.

title: Alternate wetting and drying (AWD) in Asia
narrative: Alternate wetting and drying is a water saving technology that enables irrigated rice cultivation with less water than the conventional practice of maintaining the field continuously flooded. Under AWD, ﬁelds are subjected to intermittent ﬂooding where irrigation is interrupted, and water is allowed to subside until the soil reaches a certain moisture level, after which the field is re-flooded. It has been reported that this technology can reduce water input and GHG without yield penalty.

title: Weather-rice-nutrient integrated decision support system (WeRise)
narrative: WeRise is a seasonal climate prediction-based decision support system for rainfed rice farmers through integration of statistical downscaling model of GCM and crop growth model. WeRise provides an optimum variety, and timing for sowing and fertilizer application which are key information to deal with yield increase in rainfed.

title: Field Calculator
narrative: Field Calculator (FC) is a decision support tool for sustainable rice production. The Field Calculator is a web-based application for data collection and impact assessment of inputs and practices in rice production with the aim to provide insights and options for optimization towards sustainability. Functionality of FC: (1) collect day-to-day farmer rice crop management information and (2) calculate SRP standard scores and performance indicators for use by CORIGAP NARES partners and SRP adopters

title: Rice Crop Manager
narrative: RCM is a decision-support tool designed for use by extension workers, crop advisors, agricultural service providers, and farmer leaders. It is accessible online on personal computers, tablets, or smartphones.

title: Rice Doctor Odiya
narrative: Rice Doctor Odiya is a mid-season interactive diagnostic tool in local language that aims to help extension agents, students, researchers and farmers of Odisha to identify, have accurate and timely diagnosis or at least make a short list of more than 80 possible crop pest and disease problems that can occur in all growth stages of rice throughout the state of Odisha and provide actionable advice as recommendations on their management.

title: Sustainable Rice Platform (SRP) Standard and Performance Indicators
narrative: SRP Performance Indicators are designed to assess sustainability improvements resulting from changes in farm practice, and include profitability, labor and land productivity, food safety, resource use efficiency, climate change mitigation, labor conditions, and women empowerment. The Standard defines a set of key requirements with different levels of performance allowing for a stepwise improvement and compliance process

title: AutoMonPH- a decision tool for system level water management using AWD principle
narrative: A decision tool for catalyzing the adoption of water-saving technologies by improving access to information, effective coordination among stakeholders, and transparency in water governance

title: Improved water governance
narrative: Improved water governance to unlock the production potential in polders of the coastal zone of Bangladesh
evidence_link: Sudhir-Yadav, M. Mondal, A. Shew, S.V.K. Jagadish, Z.H. Khan, A. Sutradhar, H. Bhandari, E. Humphreys, J. Bhattacharya, R. Parvin, M. Rahman, P. Chandna. Making inroads to intensify agricultural productivity in the polders of the coastal zone of Bangladesh. Paper submitted to Water Resource Management on Jan 4, 2019.

title: EasyHarvest: Web based tool for linking farmers with harvesting contract service providers
narrative: Web based tool for linking farmers with harvesting contract service providers / combine harvester operators for scheduling harvesting operations, matching field conditions with available machine types and optimizing the scheduling.

title: Laser land leveling in Cambodia, Vietnam, Thailand
narrative: Precision land leveling using a stationary laser plane at the side of the field, a 4-wheel tractor pulled drag bucket equipped with a receiver, control box and hydraulics to keep the drag bucket at the same height with reference to the laser plane. Laser leveling allows field leveling with +/-1cm accuracy and leads to water savings (40-60%), increased yields 10-20%, better weed control and can also be used for field consolidation for improved mechanization.

title: Laser land leveling in Indonesia, Philippines, Myanmar, Sri Lanka
narrative: Precision land leveling using a stationary laser plane at the side of the field, a 4-wheel tractor pulled drag bucket equipped with a receiver, control box and hydraulics to keep the drag bucket at the same height with reference to the laser plane. Laser leveling allows field leveling with +/-1cm accuracy and leads to water savings (40-60%), increased yields 10-20%, better weed control and can also be used for field consolidation for improved mechanization.

title: Bio-diversified upland rice based cropping systems designing
narrative: A set of multi-year experiments contributed as a decision tool for extension service and farmers to improve fertility and pest management of upland rice based cropping systems.

title: SeedCast mobile app
narrative: Innovative mobile app to estimate seed demand for rice varieties in Odisha, India. SeedCast will help estimate demand for varieties of rice seeds, which makes nearly 80% of the Kharif cultivation.
