narrative: CIPRiSSA conveys the seriousness of governments and establish the credibility of the business concept. It will also help investors and citizens who are not familiar with the investment requirements in each segment of the rice value chain as well as the benefits derivable from such investments. In addition, it will help to attract established businesses and start-up of new lines of activity.

title: Investment Policy for Tanzania (CIPRiSSA-Tanzania)
narrative: CIPRiSSA conveys the seriousness of governments and establish the credibility of the business concept. It will also help investors and citizens who are not familiar with the investment requirements in each segment of the rice value chain as well as the benefits derivable from such investments. In addition, it will help to attract established businesses and start-up of new lines of activity.

title: Investment Policy for Sierra Leone (CIPRiSSA-Sierra Leone)
narrative: CIPRiSSA conveys the seriousness of governments and establish the credibility of the business concept. It will also help investors and citizens who are not familiar with the investment requirements in each segment of the rice value chain as well as the benefits derivable from such investments. In addition, it will help to attract established businesses and start-up of new lines of activity.

title: Investment Policy for The Gambia (CIPRiSSA-The Gambia)
narrative: CIPRiSSA conveys the seriousness of governments and establish the credibility of the business concept. It will also help investors and citizens who are not familiar with the investment requirements in each segment of the rice value chain as well as the benefits derivable from such investments. In addition, it will help to attract established businesses and start-up of new lines of activity

title: High-throughput molecular assays for screening polyphenol oxidase (PPO) activity and phytic acid content
narrative: Developed high-throughput assays for screening polyphenol oxidase (PPO) activity and phytic acid content in the wheat grain. These compounds are undesirable in high quantities as they can cause discoloration of wheat products and reduce the bio-availability of micro-nutrients like iron and zinc. Our assays can be used for routinely evaluating breeding lines and the molecular markers identified to be associated with these traits can be used for selecting against these traits.

title: 28 new high yielding and stress tolerant hybrids for Ethiopia and Uganda
narrative: High yielding and stress tolerant hybrids developed from genetically pure lines
evidence_link: Thirty-five selected highland adapted maize hybrids were evaluated across 12 locations in Ethiopia and Uganda. Data were collected on grain yield, agronomic traits and reaction to foliar diseases (mainly, Turcicum leaf blight and common leaf rust). Based on the data, 28 hybrids which showed desirable performances for all studied traits were selected for further evaluation for possible release after confirming stability of the performances.

title: Gap analysis of crop modeling activities within CGIAR and collaborators
narrative: We have been conducting a CGIAR wide gap analysis to determine strengths, weaknesses/gaps, opportunities, and threats of CGIAR centers in terms of modeling capacity, skills and expertize. The objective of the study is to determine how modeling can support other research and outreach activities within CGIAR centers, to identify best practices in terms of modeling tools and methods, opportunities and needs in terms of funding, infrastructural support and access to databases, and finally collaboration opportunities.

title: Early Warning System to mitigate wheat blast in Bangladesh
narrative: This Early Warning System (EWS) for wheat blast disease was developed by T. Krupnik (CIMMYT) and collaborators with the support from the Crop Modeling CoP mini-grant program. The overall objective is to develop a flexible computing environment that will eventually permit model users to explore a range of sowing dates, weather conditions, and cultivar effects on wheat blast infection.

title: Conceptual framework to identify and analyze food system innovations that can lead to improvements in the choices available to consumers and their diets
narrative: Multidisciplinary framework that identifies entry points for the design of potential food systems innovations, highlighting potential synergies, feedback, and tradeoffs within the food system.

title: Use of modeling tools to simulate the impact of climate change on wheat and barley production
narrative: The studies used an ensemble of crop simulation models to estimate yield and phenology of wheat and barley in all regions of the world that are suitable for the production of these 2 crops. The models take into account actual weather data (historic) as well as different climate change scenarios in order to estimate their impact on phenology and yield, and the uncertainty of these estimations.

title: Super Simple Land Accounting Model
narrative: Understanding the global distribution of agricultural production provides valuable insights for policy making on agricultural development and adaptation to climate change. The IMPACT model generates broad regional aggregations of agricultural production and land use. This new land-use change model brings together climate data, cost of access and crop modeling results to develop pixel-level allocations of crops and natural lands consistent with economic simulations from the IMPACT model - providing more refined evidence to decision makers.

title: Expansion of FarmDESIGN, a model to examine farm household trade-offs and synergies
narrative: Farm models have the potential to describe farming systems and livelihoods, identify trade-offs and synergies, and provide ex-ante assessments of agricultural technologies and policies. The FarmDESIGN model was expanded with new budget, labor, and nutrition modules which enable scenario exploration at the farm scale. These modules increase the scope for modeling flows of resources between the farm enterprise and the farm household as well as beyond the farm gate.

title: Food Based Dietary Guidelines:  Dietary recommendations for Ethiopians for increased diet quality, including diversity and food safety for optimal health
narrative: Food-based dietary guidelines (FBDG) are evidence-based recommendations intended to establish a basis for food and agricultural policies, public nutrition and health policies, alongside nutrition education programs to foster healthy eating habits and lifestyles. More than 100 countries have FBDG, which are adapted to their nutrition situation, food availability, culinary cultures, and eating habits. A4NH researchers are working with local and international partners to develop FBDG for Ethiopia.

title: Climate services for protection against wheat blast in Bangladesh
narrative: An advisory system that can be used by farmers to protect their wheat crops from wheat blast. This system has been completed and is reaching >850 extension agents regularly with updated blast advisories. The system has been adopted and endorsed by Bangladesh's Department of Agricultural Extension, Meteorological Department, and Bangladesh Wheat and Maize Research Institute.

title: Cultivar mixtures to reduce wheat blast
narrative: The Cereal Systems for South Asia (CSISA) project evaluated the effects of late wheat sowing on wheat blast severity and incidence across different wheat varieties. The project selected the three BARI varieties to test in differing seeding mixtures. Preliminary results strongly indicate that farmers who lack sufficient BARI Gom 33 seed can still achieve reduced blast infections and maintain yield by mixing this variety with other commonly available but disease susceptible varieties, except BARI Gom 26.

title: Machine learning innovations to improve maize nutrient management recommendations  in the eastern IndoGangetic Plains
narrative: To develop more precise and efficient nutrient management for maize in the eastern IndoGangetic Plains, the spatial variability of relative yields predicted by data-driven machine learning approaches will need to be combined with information on farmers’ crop management practices and robust attainable yield estimates.

title: Four improved wheat blast resistant cultivars for Bolivia (1) and India (3)
narrative: In 2019, one blast resistant variety, INIAF OKINAWA, was released in Bolivia. In India three blast resistant varieties were released HD3249, DBW252 and DBW187.
evidence_link: https://csisa.org/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2019/11/Annual-Technical-Report-01Oct18-to-30Sep19-CSISA-III-31Oct19.pdf; See also variety release list in Annual Report 2019 under Table 4.

title: Wheat straw reaper-bailers to improve livestock feeding practices in Nepal
narrative: Four-wheel tractors with attached wheat bailers are used to more efficiently gather straw for use as livestock feed. This innovation is helping to address the problem of managing wheat straw in Nepal's Terai, by replacing the problematic former solution of burning the straw, which leads to a decline in soil fertility and increased air pollution.

title: Technical, financial and institutional feasibility assessment of DNA fingerprinting for varietal monitoring
narrative:
•	Institutions that can be involved in the mainstreaming of DNA FP at a national level are identified and their roles and responsibilities are mapped. 
•	DNA FP use-cases and institutional readiness for mainstreaming are assessed.
•	The potential use of DNA FP as a routine variety adoption monitoring tool is evaluated and the results show that it is reasonably feasible both technically and financially. 
•	Widespread use of DNA FP at a national level in Ethiopia requires continuous capacity building, investment, and coordination across institutions.

title: Strategic plan for maize in Mexico towards 2030
narrative: This plan was developed to assist the Mexican administration in strategy development for the sector. It takes into account production, consumption aspects as trade and processing

title: Collective Trademark "MILPAIZ" for Native Maize in Mexico
narrative: In June of 2019 we obtained the approval from the Mexican Government for a collective trademark, "MILPAIZ" which will signify that the maize has been certified by experts to be native maize from Mexico, grown in its  historically documented area of evolution by small scale farmers who have traditionally conserved these maizes. This is the first collective trademark for Native Maize in Mexico.

title: Potential economic benefits of BARI Gom 33: a blast-resistant bio-fortified wheat variety for Bangladesh
narrative: In Bangladesh, more than 55% of the total wheat-growing area is vulnerable to wheat blast. The potential economic benefits of the BARI Gom 33 wheat variety, which is resistant to wheat blast, bio-fortified, and has an increased yield of 5-8%, far exceeds its dissemination cost by 2029–30. Even if dissemination of the new wheat variety is limited to only the ten currently blast-affected districts, the yearly average net benefits could amount to USD 0.23–1.6 million.

title: Rice Functional and Genomic Breeding (RFGB) v2.0 database to link genotypic and phenotypic datasets, facilitates access and uploading of genomic data
narrative: Rice Functional and Genomic Breeding (RFGB) v2.0 is a database developed to bridge gaps between phenotypic and genotypic data sets of sequenced genome. RFGB was developed for breeding applications in 2015 based on SNP and InDel data from the 3000 Rice Genomes) project. This latest version has a Seed request function to help users to access the 3,000 Rice Genomes seeds and contribute your data to RFGB to upload their own phenotypic data.

title: Controlled vocabulary dictionary for UAV, phenotyping and image data annotation
narrative: Controlled vocabulary dictionary was devised and annotated for data collected by Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAV) which includes drones and are used in various research aspects, for example in field phenotyping. Drone (and other UAV)  data variables and metadata have been identified for standardization and will be used to develop an ontology starting from the controlled vocabulary. These controlled vocabularies are used for integrated data analysis between different experiements and different data collection methods.

title: Big data technology and near real-time production tracking to improve small-scale fisheries management
narrative: A digital catch documentation system combined with tamper-proof, solar powered trackers (developed by partner Pelagic Data Systems) provides near real-time small-scale fisheries production and effort information to government fisheries managers on a decision dashboard using open-source software

title: Global rice array antenna and reference panel genotyping data
narrative: Genotyping By Sequencing (GBS) data on the reference panel curated and made available for use. Resequencing data on the antenna panel obtained, analyzed, curated and made available for use. The data made available in this platform provides open access phenotypic and genotypic information and data analysis tools to global users with the objective of increasing the conservation and use of genetic resources.

title: Trial data on the antenna and reference panels for 10 locations is available on the project's website
narrative: Trial data on the antenna and reference panels were made available for use, with phenotyping and weather data from 10 locations. This is to establish a multi-environment field network serving as a tool to design site-specific rice ideotypes adapted to future climates. Data will feed crop modelers to generate better adapted varieties at a faster rate considering information on yield potential and effects of biotic/abiotic factors to yield variability by environment and varietal type.

title: Pheno-I: a new drone and satellite image analysis software
narrative: Pheno i is a simple web based application to analyses drone and satellite images rapidly and give the decision support to plant breeders and farmers. Using this  Pheno i platform farmers can map the physical features of the farm to evaluate water flow, germination and productivity zones of their farms. Breeders can assess traits quickly such as plant height, canopy cover, biomass, nitrogen use efficiency, resistance to pest and diseases, canopy temperature etc.

title: Pathotracer, an informed-decision platform to reduce the risk of rice diseases
narrative: Pathotracer is a platform that integrates early-season pathogen disease diagnostics to accurately define breeding priorities and guide coordinated actions to manage crop diseases in real-time for key diseases in Asia and Africa. For example, the toolkit helps identify specific genetic strains of the bacterial blight to specific regions to help develop a resistance profile of rice varieties to customize the deployment and manage local outbreaks. It can be found at http://webapps.irri.org/pathotracer/

title: Approach to encourage market actors to invest in food safety by stimulating consumer demand for safer maize flour in Kenya
narrative: This approach provides Kenyan consumers with information about the relative safety of different maize flour brands. Households are given general information on aflatoxin contamination and the effects of consuming contaminated foods and some households are given additional information on two brands that have been found to be more likely to meet the Kenyan aflatoxin regulation limit along with test results showing the aflatoxin status of the flour being consumed.

title: Farmers’ willingness to pay for small-scale maize shelling machine study in Tanzania
narrative: Maize shelling is one of the labor-intensive and arduous activities among smallholder farmers in Tanzania. There are possibilities to mechanize maize shelling. This study explores farmers’ willingness to pay (WTP) for small-scale maize shelling machines

title: Improved monitoring of crop phenology with smartphone images for Indian farmers
narrative: This innovation relies on smartphone pictures of targeted crops. Farmers send in images of their fields from sowing to harvest through a dedicated smartphone application. All pictures are georeferenced and time stamped. Visual aids help farmers taking the picture consistently throughout the season from the same location and with the same view frame. The images offer granular high-resolution information to monitor crops from the ground, and offer a source of ground truth information.

title: Agriculture and Food Security Maprooms
narrative: FP4 supported Maproom development though P266 and P363 over several years. The Maprooms open with a map view of spatial statistics, and provide additional analyses at selected locations including: rain day frequency, rainfall intensity, wet/dry spell frequency, season onset/cessation dates, and optionally growing degree-days and chill units (https://iridl.ldeo.columbia.edu/maproom/ACToday/).   “Flexible Forecast” presentation overcomes the main limitations of conventional seasonal forecasts. Maprooms were upgraded, and taken up by several new countries in 2019.

title: Athelia Biodeiversity Fund Brazil (ABF-Brazil)
narrative: The Althelia Biodiversity Fund Brazil (“ABF Brazil”) is a new US$100 million impact investment fund dedicated to making pioneering impact investments in the Legal Amazon to promote cliamte-smart agriculture (CSA) building innovative solutions for sustainable development, conservation of biodiversity, forests and natural resources of the Amazon.

title: Resilience for development framework that supports the integrated analysis of climate change, gender, youth and nutrition (CGYN)
narrative: Developed for IFAD to guide its programming and investments integrating the four areas, it uses the notion of resilience to develop a coherent, inclusive and rigorous method to plan for interventions and analyze on-going interventions that work at the intersection of multiple disciplines. It is based on in-country studies in 5 Sub-Saharan African countries, to generate lessons for transformation. They dentify policy gaps for transformation, and clarify impact pathways linking project interventions to national outcomes.

title: Averting wheat blast by implementing a ‘wheat holiday’: In search of alternative crops in West Bengal, India.
narrative: The present scoping study assesses the potential economic feasibility of alternative crops to wheat. Of the ten crops considered, maize, gram (chickpea), urad (black gram), rapeseed and mustard, and potatoes are found to be potentially feasible alternative crops. Any crop substitution would need support to ease the transition including addressing the challenges related to the management of alternative crops, ensuring adequate crop combinations and value chain development.

title: Candidates for crop rotation to prevent wheat blast in Bangladesh
narrative: This study examines the feasibility of alternative use of wheat land. Maize, potato, lentil, onion and garlic may replace wheat in Bangladesh.

title: Combining new adaptive crop genetic traits with increased N fertilizer improves yield in new semi-arid environments in Mexico
narrative: Mexico’s wheat production is likely to decline under future climate change impacts. Expanding wheat area to recently used land for wheat may be the most effective adaptation strategy to combat production loss from future climate change. Adaptation measures were simulated individually and in various combinations with a multi-crop model and multi-Global Climate Model ensemble across representative wheat growing regions and aggregated to national wheat production. Under both baseline (current) and future climate scenarios, most of the suggested individual and combined genetic traits resulted in a positive impact on irrigated wheat but were less beneficial in rainfed systems.

title: Innovative use of satellite data from remote sensing and supervised learning to reduce the impact of drought on crop production
narrative: There is potential to use large quantities of historical satellite data gathered using remote sensing, and deep learning to better plan for weather events. This method may be used in place of agricultural indices (AIs) reflecting the soil water conditions that influence crop conditions, which are costly to monitor in terms of time and resources.

title: Farmers' preferences for high-input agriculture supported by site-specific extension services in Nigeria
narrative: Site-specific extension recommendations that are better tailored to the needs of individual farmers and fields, and enabled by digital technologies, could potentially bring about yield and productivity improvements

title: Blockchain Technology,  system that could guarantee the origin of the biofortified seeds.
narrative:
Due to the invisible nature of the enhanced seeds, counterfeit products are common, limiting wide-scale adoption of biofortified crops. Fraudulent seeds pose a major obstacle in the adoption of biofortified crops.
 A system that could guarantee the origin of the biofortified seeds is therefore required to ensure widespread adoption. This trust-ensuring immutable proof for the biofortified seeds, can be provided via blockchain technology.

title: A spatial framework for ex-ante impact assessment of agricultural technologies
narrative:
We developed a spatial framework to guide agricultural research & development.


The framework integrates both biophysical and socio-economic factors.


The framework is used to estimate potential impact and return on investment.


We provide proof of concept using a maize project in three countries in SSA.


The framework is flexible and generic to be applied across a wide range of programs.

title: Assessment of climate adaptation options for cereal-based systems in the eastern Indo-Gangetic Plains, South Asia
narrative: Integration of new cropping system treatments and genetic improvements simultaneously for wheat based systems adaptation to future climate change

title: Underutilised food species database with nutrition data, common and local names, medicinal uses and links to recipes
narrative: The database currently displays information for 185 prioritized underutilised food species. Entries include nutrition data, common and local names, medicinal uses and links to recipes, when available. Additional nutrition information is available for some species at the variety level. This database fills a gap in global food composition information. Global databases and food composition tables tend not to include nutritional values of orphan crops nor traditional knowledge associated with their collection, preparation and use.

title: Participatory community-based farm diversification and nutrition education approach to increase farm, market and dietary diversity in Kenya
narrative: This intervention approach applies community participation throughout in a way that allows researchers to understand the communities' context, and allows the communities to gain ownership from the outset and decide autonomously how to create changes in their environment. Research was conducted in Vihiga County in Western Kenya on how effective an integrated, participatory approach can be on improving farm, market, and dietary diversity.

title: Application of Big Data Analytics to Consolidate Fertilizer Trial Data into a Farmer-Support Tool
narrative: Fertilizer field trial data were scattered among many agencies in Ethiopia, making targeting recommendations impossible. WLE/CIAT supported the Ministry of Agriculture to use new tools to organize the data sets into a useful decision-support tool. This innovative application of Big Data analytics has been adopted as Ministry policy.

title: Re-configuring Community seed bank functions, by building on their social capital to incorporate landscape management and restoration
narrative: While Community Seed Banks (CSB) are not an innovation as such, its function was largely to disseminate seeds. This innovation is to reconfigure the functions of community seed banks in ways that they can serve more than one purpose, in this case landscape restoration and management (eg. participatory selection of genetically diverse crops, landscape restoration) and, in the future, nutrition. CSB have a very high social capital which can be used for several purposes.

title: Predicting yields using crop simulation models and gridded weather data in India
narrative: The accuracy of statistical crop models to quantify how yields will respond to weather shocks and future climate change depends on the quality of the underlying input data used to run these models. In this context, a major challenge is the lack of accessible and reliable meteorological datasets. Gridded weather datasets, derived from combinations of in situ gauges, remote sensing, and climate models, provide a solution to fill this gap and strengthen statistical crop models.

title: Farmer training on aflatoxin prevention using low-cost, locally available materials, combined with market incentives for safer food
narrative: Intervention strategies included training on aflatoxin and its prevention, distribution of free drying sheets, and a price premium for groundnuts that comply with local aflatoxin regulations. All strategies are designed to address barriers smallholders face to improve food safety and quality: low awareness, high input costs, and the failure of premium prices to pass through to producers.

title: Food safety risk analysis frameworks adapted for use in informal value chains in low-and middle-income countries
narrative: Participatory risk assessment was developed as a way of assessing food safety risks at low cost and informal markets

title: Risk assessment for food transmitted disease in informal markets in and low-and middle-income countries
narrative: Risk assessment a) allows rational prioritisation; b) shows the burden of the problem stimulating investment; c) identifies critical control points where risk can be managed. The demand for risk assessment to evaluate the safety of foods is increasing in low and middle income countries, but risk assessors need practical steps to conduct such assessments, particularly in wet markets or informal value chains.

title: Addition of mycotoxin binders to animal feeds to reduce aflatoxin concentration in cow milk: adaptation to smallholder dairy systems in low- and middle-income countries
narrative: Adding mycotoxin binders to animal feeds can reduce aflatoxin concentration in cow milk. ILRI research is investigating how this innovation can be adapted for use in smallholder dairy in low- and middle-income countries. Little is known about how adding binders to animal feeds works in  smallholder dairy systems nor if they can be sourced locally and at low-cost.

title: Participatory mapping of foodscapes in informal settlements in urban areas of Kenya
narrative: Multiple approaches - participatory geographic information system tools, including food mapping with mobile apps and high‐resolution community aerial views with balloon mapping - were combined to capture and contextualize local knowledge of the foodscape. These multiple visual representations of foodscapes make local food vendors, and the risks they face, visible, and can be a useful tool for community-led priority setting and advocacy with local authorities.

title: Power through: A new concept in the empowerment discourse
narrative: The four definitions of empowerment fail to capture something important in the way empowerment can be experienced. The concept of ‘power through’ aims to define this analytically distinct dimension of power. The paper presents a suggestion, and the supporting evidence, of a new element to be added to the well-established four elements of empowerment. So the innovation brings a new dimension to the empowerment discourse.

title: Framework to assess data exchange in transboundary waters
narrative: We have developed a framework for assessing the strength of data exchange in transboundary waters and applied (or piloted) that framework in 25 river basins. It provides a measure of the level of data sharing among countries sharing a river basin.

title: Stepwise approach for fomulating country-level target goals for elimination of taenia solium taeniosis/cysticercosis (one of the top ranked foodborne parasitic hazards globally)
narrative: A step-wise approach, like has been used for rabies control, can provide a framework for the development of realistic control goals, the implementation of intervention algorithms, and standardized monitoring of progress towards obtaining the control target goals and eventually elimination. The approach follows these steps: provision of evidence; policy discussion; formal prioritisation of T. solium in strategy documents at government level; and then makes these relevant to the county level.

title: Mobile-phone application with zoonotic disease information for smallholder farmers in East Africa
narrative: LRI partnered with Green Dream Tech to integrate information on zoonotic diseases into iCow, a mobile phone agricultural platform operating in East Africa. Now the 600,000 subscribers (smallholder farmers) on the iCow platform can obtain information on zoonotic diseases, especially those that impair livestock production, when they place a request. iCow is designed for the most basic feature phones and is available in different languages depending on the country.

title: Integrated (human health and animal health) surveillance and reporting system for 15 zoonotic diseases in Kenya
narrative: The integrated surveillance and reporting system in Kenya combines entomological surveillance with disease surveillance of animals in markets and slaughterhouses with disease surveillance of humans at hospital sentinel sites and a single laboratory processing material for diagnosis of 15 different zoonotic infections. The unified field and laboratory reporting system is based on a commercial-sector designed application on smartphones and is accessible to county-level and national-level governments. System is described in https://doi.org/10.3389/fvets.2019.00252.

title: Fluorescence Polarization Assay (FPA):  rapid diagnostic field test for brucellosis in ruminants in low-resource settings and tropic conditions like Cote d'Ivoire
narrative: While most diagnostic tests for brucellosis can only be performed in the laboratory, the Fluorescence Polarization Assay (FPA) was developed as a rapid point-of-care field test. Validation studies have shown FPA to be highly accurate, with reported specificities of 100, 99.4, and 98.6% in cattle, goats, and sheep, respectively. However, there is little information on the performance of the FPA in low-resource settings and tropic conditions.

title: Developing government capacity in geospatial tools for land water analysis in Myanmar, enabling rice crop flood-damage prevention measures.
narrative: Although Myanmar's agriculture and climate change policies call for climate-smart food systems, poor capacity to use geo-spatial tools for land-water analysis hinders policy implementation. The geo-spatial maps developed enables the Department of Agriculture in Myanmar, for the first time, to take measures to minimize flood damage to rice crops based on up-to-date data. The maps replace manually developed mapped dating several decades ago.

title: Remote sensing maps on climatic trends to improve targeting of climate-smart agricultural technologies in West Africa
narrative: The generated maps on climatic trends will inform priority setting when out-scaling of climate smart agricultural technologies. For example, areas experiencing decline in rainfall could be targeted for scaling out drought tolerant varieties. The spatial evidence on climatic trends could help to target climate smart agricultural technologies to their suitable climatic context to reduce their risk of failure and enhance rate of adoption

title: CubicA - Agriculture Advisory App: The right information, at the right time, to the right farmer
narrative: CubicA is an Agriculture*Advisory*App which intends to bridge the farmers’ information gap. It works like a search engine which doesn’t require internet connectivity, whereby any farmer can simply call a free hotline to get weather and agricultural information anywhere, anytime, in local languages, on any mobile device. Through the integration of ML & big data, CubicA leverages previous caller data to guarantee the right information is delivered at the right time to the right farmer.

title: Farm.ink Digital Learning Platform
narrative: Our new farm.ink digital learning platform enables our agronomic content partners to quickly generate interactive training courses and publish them to our partners.

title: Recommendations to implement policy reforms that encourage women’s participation in irrigation management in Egypt
narrative: Participation in irrigation management is influenced by the socioeconomic and political norms that prevail in rural communities. In Egypt, women’s involvement in irrigation practices is undervalued and women's participation in water governance remains low. Institutional support and policy reforms – such as introducing gender-based quotas in Water User Associations and implementing awareness campaigns to promote gender equality – are key to ensuring that women share in the benefits of irrigation.

title: MARPLE (Mobile And Real-time PLant disEase) diagnostics. Rapid and accurate point-of-care (PoC) diagnostics for wheat yellow rust
narrative:
A portable, genomics-based, point-of-care approach specifically tailored to identify individual strains of complex
fungal plant pathogens. Uses targeted sequencing to overcome the size of fungal genomes. Focusing on the wheat yellow rust pathogen, Puccinia striiformis f.sp. tritici (Pst), this approach can be used to rapidly define individual strains, assign strains to distinct genetic lineages that have been shown to correlate tightly with their virulence profiles and monitor genes of importance.

title: Use of Commercial Microwave Links (CMLs) in estimating rainfall in Kenya
narrative: This key innovation is to use the real data from Kenya to provide evidence that supports this approach is reliable. We found that in some cases the gauges completely missed a rainy episode while the CML approach was able to detect that rain. In other cases we found advantages as compared to Climate Hazards Group InfraRed Precipitation with Station data (CHIRPS).

title: Nutrition training roadmap for administrators across India
narrative: This nutrition training roadmap identifies key actors who are influential in shaping nutrition related policy and program decisions, their different roles, key nutrition content areas where capacity needs to be built (e.g., evidence on effective interventions), and the primary skills key actors need to be effective. The next step will be curriculum content development.

title: Rice leaf rolling under drought conditions is not a selection criteria for drought tolerance
narrative: In both aus and tropical japonica diversity panels, we used physiological and genetic approaches to show that rice leaf rolling under drought was not related to drought tolerance, and we concluded that leaf rolling should not be used as a selection criterion for drought breeding.
evidence_link: Our open access publication in Plant, Cell, and Environment: https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1111/pce.13514 Our datasets on Dataverse: https://dataverse.harvard.edu/dataverse/DOI101111pce13514

title: Use of free Wi-Fi to better understand food and people flow in markets in Hanoi
narrative: We implemented two different strategies to gather anonymous information about food and people flow in markets. 1) We ask users to answer a single question each time they connect to the network. Following the 5Q method, the questions are based on previous answers 2) We set-up the Wi-Fi routers and signal amplifiers to register and keep track of each “Active Scanning” request they receive, this way we monitor  when/where/how many people are in the markets.

title: Muracho: a new biofortified vitamin A banana/plantain variety in Burundi
narrative:
Variety of biofortified vitamin A banana/plantain released in Burundi.

Key traits of interest: AAB plantain from the Philippines; cooking type, which can be cooked and consumed at any ripening stage; submitted for release in Uganda and Tanzania (2021).
evidence_link: Here is the link to access the biofortified crops map: https://www.harvestplus.org/sites/default/files/publications/HP_2019_CropMap_update_v5_0515.pdf.  The revised version of the crop map will include this variety. An internal HarvestPlus database, along with the breeding reports, can be made available upon request.

title: I070593: a new biofortified vitamin A cassava variety in Cameroon
narrative:
Variety of biofortified vitamin A cassava released in Cameroon.

Key traits of interest: CMD and CGM tolerance, CBB and CAD resistance; cooks/boils well, not mealy; sweet taste (low HCN).
evidence_link: Here is the link to access the biofortified crops map: https://www.harvestplus.org/sites/default/files/publications/HP_2019_CropMap_update_v5_0515.pdf.  The revised version of the crop map will include this variety. An internal HarvestPlus database, along with the breeding reports, can be made available upon request.

title: First experimental evidence that increasing women's empowerment through a nutrition- and gender-sensitive agriculture program improves child nutrition in Burkina Faso
narrative: The is the first published study to demonstrate with longitudinal data how improving women's empowerment through a gender- and nutrition-sensitive agriculture program is a pathway to reducing child wasting, but not anemia in Burkina Faso.The "agriculture to nutrition pathways' is a well-known and widely used CGIAR innovation. This randomized controlled trial demonstrated that the women's empowerment pathway is a pathway by which a nutrition-sensitive program can improve child wasting.

title: TMS 09/0090: a new variety of biofortified vitamin A cassava in Ghana
narrative:
Variety of biofortified vitamin A cassava released in Ghana.

Differentiation for other new vitamin A cassava innovations: CMD resistance, good DM, high TBC, for use as gari and crispy chips.
evidence_link: Here is the link to access the biofortified crops map: https://www.harvestplus.org/sites/default/files/publications/HP_2019_CropMap_update_v5_0515.pdf. Key additional traits: 3rd wave variety with full target level for VitA, 3-way hybrid, high yielding (>6 t/ha).

title: CENTA A-Nutremas: vara new biofortified zinc rice variety released in El Salvador
narrative:
Variety of biofortified zinc rice released in El Salvador.

Key trait of interest: High yielding (>7 t/ha).
evidence_link: Here is the link to access the biofortified crops map: https://www.harvestplus.org/sites/default/files/publications/HP_2019_CropMap_update_v5_0515.pdf.  The revised version of the crop map will include this variety. An internal HarvestPlus database, along with the breeding reports, can be made available upon request.

title: Agrosavia Aurora: a new vitamin A sweet potato variety released in Colombia
narrative:
Variety of vitamin A sweet potato released in Colombia.

Key traits of interest: High yielding (>20 t/ha), high DM (30%), suitable for flour production; dual-purpose (root and leaves/biomass); adapted to dry and wet Caribbean Region.
evidence_link: Here is the link to access the biofortified crops map: https://www.harvestplus.org/sites/default/files/publications/HP_2019_CropMap_update_v5_0515.pdf.  The revised version of the crop map will include this variety. An internal HarvestPlus database, along with the breeding reports, can be made available upon request.

title: INIAF Okinawa: a new biofortified zinc wheat variety released in Bolivia
narrative:
Variety of biofortified zinc wheat released in Bolivia.

Key traits of interest: Early maturing, widely adapted; >70% zinc target level.
evidence_link: Here is the link to access the biofortified crops map: https://www.harvestplus.org/sites/default/files/publications/HP_2019_CropMap_update_v5_0515.pdf.  The revised version of the crop map will include this variety. An internal HarvestPlus database, along with the breeding reports, can be made available upon request.

title: HUW 711 (M​ayil #4​): a new biofortified zinc wheat variety released in India
narrative:
Variety of biofortified zinc wheat released in India.

Key trait of interest: Released for Uttar Pradesh State; 10% higher yield than local checks.
evidence_link: Here is the link to access the biofortified crops map: https://www.harvestplus.org/sites/default/files/publications/HP_2019_CropMap_update_v5_0515.pdf.  The revised version of the crop map will include this variety. An internal HarvestPlus database, along with the breeding reports, can be made available upon request.

title: Measures of agri-food system gross domestic product (AgGDP+) and employment (AgEMP+)
narrative: For most countries, the AgGDP+ and AgEMP+ indicators of agri-food system Gross Domestic Product and employment are the first such data to be developed.  USAID has adopted these indicators into its Global Food Security Strategy framework.

title: Use of the Agricultural Production Systems Simulator (APSIM) to assess the long-term impact of conservation agriculture on wheat-based systems in Tunisia
narrative: The Agricultural Production Systems Simulator (APSIM) model was used to predict the effect of tillage (conventional tillage [CT] vs. zero-tillage [ZT] and soil residue retention [ZT-RR]) on wheat productivity and soil fertility. This model was tested in two contrasting locations in Tunisia; one semi-arid (Kef) and one sub-humid (Bizerte). Results showed that the sustainable production of durum wheat under climate change conditions in Tunisia is possible through adoption of CA practices (ZT/ZT-RR) in both sub-humid and semi-arid areas.

title: Evidence on the relationships between presence of armed groups, armed conflict violence, and access to aid in Mopti, Mali
narrative: This paper exploits a unique panel dataset of households in Mopti which baseline was collected in January 2012, just prior to the outset of the civil war in Mali. The follow-up survey was implemented in January 2017, in the midst of a rapidly intensifying armed conflict in the region. This study sheds light on the determinants of vulnerability to conflict, on processes of armed conflict and on the relationships between aid and conflict.

title: A model of farmers' responses to irrigation water policies in Algeria
narrative: An economic assessment of volumetric irrigation prices and quotas in the Jijel–Taher irrigated perimeter was conducted. Two types of scenarios were simulated, including: (i) increasing volumetric prices of irrigation water in the studied irrigated areas; (ii) decreasing water quota scenarios allocated to the farmers. As expected, results show that increasing water prices may lead to a decreasing demand for irrigation water. However, this decrease in water demand only became significant at very high prices.

title: Analysis of the competitiveness of wheat and orange farming in Tunisia under water shortage scenarios
narrative: This study urges decision-makers to put more efforts to optimize irrigation management at field and farm levels through dissemination of better irrigation scheduling techniques and implementing deficit irrigation strategies especially that the country is under a critical water shortage.

title: Climate change adaptation options for smallholders in South Asia
narrative: This paper presents a systematic review of the impacts of climate change on crop production and also the major options in the agricultural sector that are available for adaptation to climate change. One of the key conclusions is that agricultural practices that help climate change adaptation in agriculture are available, while the institutional setup to implement and disseminate those technical solutions is yet to be strengthened.

title: Maize hybrids with high yield potential for lowlands, mid-altitudes, and highlands.
narrative: 2019: 61 hybrids were selected for their competitive yield and favorable agronomic characteristics compared to commercial testers (trials established in localities of Mexico of two to eleven). The following objective is to validate their yield and agronomic characteristics through their evaluation in a greater number of localities (25 to 45 localities) to release the best ones to Mexican seed companies.

title: 60 hybrids selected to be evaluated in the 2019 collaborative evaluation network of MasAgro.
narrative: 60 CIMMYT hybrids were selected and evaluated in 31 to 36 localities of Mexico in 2019. Thirteen hybrids excelled in the results of this evaluation for their high yield potential and agronomic characteristics as candidates to be released to Mexican seed companies.

title: CIM17MMT04: A new maize hybrid with high yield potential released in Mexico.
narrative: In 2019, more than 20 CIMMYT hybrids and varieties were produced and sold by the MasAgro-Maize seed companies, of which a new hybrid (CIM17MMT04) was integrated for the first time into the Mexican maize seed market.

title: Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) regional action plan for rice self-sufficiency by 2025
narrative: Currently, the ECOWAS region depends on imports from Asia to fulfill about half of its consumption need. ECOWAS initiated a regional offensive to reach rice self-sufficiency by 2025. The Regional Offensive for sustainable and sustained recovery of rice production in West Africa Programme was approved by the ECOWAS Council of Ministers in June 2014. This Offensive aims to reduce imports to zero by 2025. AfricaRice contributes to ECOWAS - see also the related RICE policy.

title: Sire certification for small ruminant community based breeding programs
narrative: Improved genetics generated in pilot community-based breeding programs have to be disseminated to the base population. This could be done either through natural mating or AI. The improved sires need to be of higher genetic value, free from reproductive diseases and should show good breeding soundness. The certification process ensures that sires have all attributes.

title: Rice Galaxy: an open database for bioinformatic & molecular breeding analysis using 3K sequencing information
narrative: Rice Galaxy is a freely available resource that empowers the plant research community to perform state-of-the-art analyses and utilize publicly available big datasets for both fundamental and applied science. It has shared datasets such as 3000 rice genomes, Antenna Panel and others. Tools are available from the galaxy tool shed (http://galaxytoolshed.excellenceinbreeding.org) including for designing single-nucleotide polymorphism assays, analyzing genome-wide association studies, population diversity, rice−bacterial pathogen diagnostics, and a suite of published genomic prediction methods.

title: National policy for restructuring the Vietnamese rice sector: Towards 2020 and Vision to 2030
narrative: IRRI' proposed a technical assistance package for the reformation of Vietnam's rice industry. In 2014, a workshop on reforming Vietnam's rice industry was held. This two-day workshop consisted of participants from the national and provincial governments, private sector, national agriculture research extension systems, key departments of MARD and other relevant ministries. Several innovation developed by IRRI were proposed in the restructuring strategy: Alternate Wetting and Dryin, Stress-tolerant varieties, Rice crop Manager, post-harvest technologies, etc.

title: Access of youth agripreneurs to agricultural finance for entrepreneurship and self-employment
narrative: In Africa, rural youth unemployment is the main cause of rural exodus and emigration. The innovation aims to bolster the rural youth potential through capacity building and entrepreneurship and to link them to the agricultural banks to have access to credit. Innovative business plans were developed covering the activities in the rice value chain and presented to the banks for cofinancing.  The models could encourage policymakers to develop special funds dedicated to youth.

title: Evidence that trust and social capital are strengthened through a youth employment program in Yemen
narrative: This innovation demonstrates additional positive effects of a youth employment program. The program, in addition to aiding youth individually, has important benefits for the country as a whole by strengthening inter-regional trust levels, an important aspect of future reconstruction and post-conflict recovery.

title: Women’s Land Rights Conceptual Framework
narrative: The conceptual framework is used to analyze and understand the factors that influence women’s land tenure security. It is designed to be relevant to both researchers and practitioners.

title: Deep Learning for Image-Recognition-Based Cassava Disease Detection
narrative: We trained a convolutional neural network on a cassava image database to identify three diseases and two types of pest damage: brown leaf spot, red mite damage, green mite damage, brown streak disease, and cassava mosaic disease. Results show that image recognition is an easily deployable strategy for disease detection. More evidence: https://www.frontiersin.org/articles/10.3389/fpls.2019.00272/full

title: Protocol and pipeline for identifying superior cross-bred dairy bulls for use in smallholder farming systems, including via the use of genomics
narrative: 1930 genotyped cows with 9193 test day milk records have been used to estimate genetic parameters that were used for the first genomic predictions for tanzania, and the best bulls identified for national use. Various analytical models used and results have been shared in conferences.

title: Technology for biobanking African poultry breeds (primordial germ cell cryo-storage)
narrative: The continuous supply of exotic chicken into the tropics posed the threat of extinction of existing local ecotypes. If the need for more eggs and meat remains critical, introduction of improved genetics continues while innovations that can save the local chicken from extinction through introduction of exotic chicken are needed.  So far there was no existing technology available for biobanking of chicken germplasm - this is thus a newly developed technology supporting chicken biodiversity conservation.

title: Mobile FeedApps to formulate chicken rations from locally available ingredients  in Tanzania, Nigeria, and Ethiopia
narrative: Several feed formulation apps are available. The information regarding the ingredients, the nutrient compositions of the feedstuff and the nutrient requirements of the animals were based on either literature or commercial poultry production systems. These new apps are customized to the conditions of the village poultry production systems enabling the farmers to meet the requirements of their animals more precisely using locally available feed ingredients that are not part of the commercial feed manufacturers.

title: Methodology to determine breed suitability for different agro-ecological zones using geographic information system tools and knowledge of genotype by environment interactions
narrative: The interaction of genotypes and the environment happens if the environment presents changes to the genotypes by affecting their performance. This is a new methodology that builds on the traditional approach of accessing genotype by environment interactions, to predict where breeds may be suitable for different agro-ecological zones using geographic information system data. The quantification was possible using real data collected from the field whenever introductions of genotypes into a new environment happened.

title: Expansion of maize seed systems research to the retail space
narrative: This research investigated interactions between agro-dealers, farmers, and seed companies, to better understand how to encourage the uptake of new, stress-tolerant varieties. Most agro-dealers had a wide offer of seed products available, but seed companies’ engagement with them was limited and marketing efforts were directly focused on farmers. Few farmers used the agro-dealer environment to guide their decision-making. However, when agro-dealers engaged with farmers, they influenced varietal selection in 80% of the cases.

title: A new method to assess minimum nutrient input requirements for maize in Sub Saharan Africa
narrative: This innovation will assess minimum nutrient (N, P and K) input requirements for given target yields of crops, and applied it to future maize production in sub-Saharan Africa.

title: Technical Assistance for Developing Operational Guidelines for Biofortification of Staple Food Crops
Biofortification: A food-systems solution to help end hidden hunger
narrative: Brief describing existing collaborations between the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO) and HarvestPlus; purpose is to inspire FAO staff to develop more opportunities to scale biofortification. Cites evidence from CGIAR (and others) on cost-effectiveness, and nutrition and health benefits of and number of people growing and benefiting from biofortified crops. "FAO views biofortification as one of the complementary interventions whose promotion can improve micronutrient intake and can contribute to healthy diets."

title: Quality control approach for testing maize for aflatoxin combined with commercial labeling of maize meal products as aflatoxin-safe
narrative: In order to use a label ('Aflatoxin tested - process verified by APTECA'), a cereal miller must satisfy a number of requirements. Quality control staff must pass an aflatoxin analysis proficiency test; weekly analysis of laboratory control samples must be conducted to ensure testing accuracy; and the firm must develop and adhere to a rigorous aflatoxin food safety plan, including sampling and testing procedure for inbound truckloads  batch of finished product prior to packing.

title: Modelling warming impacts on wheat to predict yield under high and low latitudes
narrative: A wheat model ensemble of 1,440 global simulations of 20 climate scenarios, 3 crop models, 4 parameterization strategies and 3 management inputs of sowing date was created. Then, the contributions of climate, model, parameterization and management to the overall uncertainty to predicted responses of yield to warming was quantified, then related to the latitude of the grid cells. For all warming scenarios, the total uncertainty for mid- and high latitudes is much larger than for low latitudes.

title: A new online crop season planning tool to reduce the risk of extreme weather events
narrative: Crop season planning is a new, free online tool for decision-support in agriculture. It simulates extreme weather event probabilities during crop development, helps minimize the risk of exposing sensitive development stages to extremes, and has successfully passed a preliminary test with US agricultural practitioners.

title: Spatial farm typology to assess suitability of conservation agriculture (CA) in Zambia
narrative: This is  an approach for technology scaling out and for ex-ante assessment using CA-based systems in Zambia combining  bottom-up and top-down approaches to examine spatial variation in biophysical and economic indicators, and then conducted a spatial farm typology analysis to assess the implications of CA-based systems beyond the field scale.

title: Iron bean delivery program in Rwanda
narrative: Since 2010, HarvestPlus, the Rwanda Agricultural Board (RAB), and CIAT have managed a successful iron bean delivery program in Rwanda. Innovative seed certification facilitated quality seed production, while direct marketing and payback delivery models increased rapid adoption and reduced disadoption, respectively. By the end of 2018, around 442,000 households were growing iron beans, with 15% of the population consuming them.

title: Signature of selection to improve effectiveness of genomic selection in temperate x tropical breeding populations
narrative: The project is seeking to use signature of selection (selection sweep) information from intensively selected germplasm in North America to more cost effectively and quickly identify progenies which have high potential in crosses involving tropical parents.

title: Groundwater Game, a water game app around sustainable water resource use for farming in India
narrative: The water game app  building on IFPRI/ICRISAT work on using games to help people understand and get a handle on group decisionmaking around sustainable water resource use for farming. More info: https://kalgudi.com/

title: Effects of policy distortions on small ruminant value chains of Ethiopia
narrative: This study, the first of its kind for small ruminant value chains in the developing world, estimates the extent to which sheep and goat value chains are affected by policy distortions in Ethiopia. Negative nominal rates of protection at farm gate and retail markets show that the government's restrictive policies have negatively affected price incentives for livestock keepers and that these are in addition to market inefficiencies.

title: Male sterile maize inbred lines
narrative: Male sterility systems reduce seed production costs, especially in a cross pollinated crop like maize.  A significant portion of the seed production cost of maize goes towards detasseling of the female parent in order to let the male parent pollinate the female parent in seed production isolations.  In addition, such systems offer an opportunity for IP protection of the inbred female parent of single cross hybrids.  Further, they could enable the imposition of heterotic discipline.

title: Institutional design guide for multiactor platforms addressing natural resource governance at landscape scale
narrative: This guide enables field practitioners and local government staff to undertake context-appropriate design and implementation of multiactor platforms, in three stages: (1) assessment of the governance context and selection from a menu of institutional design options; (2) implementation and strengthening of the platform through sustained and inclusive dialogue and action planning; (3) monitoring progress, assessing challenges, learning and adapting.

title: Woreda-level participatory land use planning for pastoral areas in Ethiopia
narrative: Woreda-level participatory land use planning (WLUP) is a process undertaken by district-level government experts working with local land users to develop a land use plan for better managing and protecting rangelands and for Woreda development planning. Joint WPLUP has also been introduced to prevent rangeland fragmentation, learning from joint village land use planning in Tanzania. A drylands-specific land capability classification is included. PIM and LIVESTOCK provided significant technical support to the development of WPLUP.

title: Interactive map of Participatory Models for Biodiversity Conservation
narrative: This interactive map illustrates examples of participatory "area-based" approaches to biodiversity conservation. It provides an overview of different models of biodiversity conservation, with links to case studies to illustrate the diversity of these models across the globe.

title: JAL SUTRA: a mobile application to support facilitation of learning games on water management in India
narrative: The JAL SUTRA mobile application supports the facilitation of learning games which were co-designed with partners under the leadership of ICRISAT under PIM. The app development was commissioned and supervised by ICRISAT, also under PIM. The App serves as a guide for game facilitators, calculates results from choices made during a game and stores information from games. This tool helps promote and monitor the uptake of the games by implementation partners.

title: New machine learning models that predict the performance of seed varieties in particular conditions
narrative: Machine-learning aided prediction of performance of seed varieties in particular conditions. Under the project machine learning-enabled analysis was run on yield, soils, and climatic data to predict the potential performance of seed varieties by location, providing breeders with a new tool to support their work.

title: A novel approach to reveal Gender in Food Systems through Big Data
narrative: Big Data and Gender Platform piloted an approach to using mobile phone metadata to predict sex and decision power among farmers in Uganda, demonstrating a method and proof of concept that mobile network metadata can be used for studying women's economic empowerment. Specific users will be gender researchers equipped with an approach for using novel data sources, holding the potential of observing changes in women's economic empowerment with greater speed and at greater scale.

title: The Rulal board game: Enabling policy practitioners and students to experience how natural resource management decisions are shaped by power relations and power dynamics
narrative: Rulal is a board game designed to facilitate dialogue and decisionmaking processes in land and water governance. Players are assigned roles such as farmer, government staff, hydropower company staff, member of civil society organization, etc. The rules of the game mimic decisionmaking mechanisms and reflect the role of power relations and power asymmetry in land and water governance.

title: Vegan Community Ecology Package
narrative: The vegan package provides tools for descriptive community ecology. It has most basic functions of diversity analysis, community ordination and dissimilarity analysis. Most of its multivariate tools can be used for other data types as well.

title: Agroforestry Species Switchboard 2.0: a new online information source to support tree research and development activities
narrative: New version of the one-stop Agroforestry Species Switchboard, which documents the presence of a total of 172,395 plant species, and 3,979 taxa at infraspecific level, across 35 web-based information sources.

title: A new online request platform for distribution of germplasm and data from trials and nurseries
narrative: Cimmyt scientists develop improved wheat lines, with resistance to globally important bitoic and abiotic stresses, and with improved nutritional and processing quality. Their germplasm banks contain the largest collections of in-trust held wheat genetic diversity, improved and conserved seed is available to any research institution, worldwide. Data about the performance of lines distributed are collected and shared with the international breeding and research community where they serve for further improvement (field books for international wheat nurseries and data results for international wheat nurseries).

title: Payments for agrobiodiversity conservation services in Peru
narrative: Payments for agrobiodiversity conservation services (PACS) provide a mechanism to incentivize conservation of crop diversity on farm.

title: Two new BiodiversityR packages for Community Ecology and Suitability Analysis
narrative: Graphical User Interface and utility functions for statistical analysis of biodiversity and ecological communities, including species accumulation curves, diversity indices, Renyi profiles, GLMs for analysis of species abundance and presence-absence, distance matrices, Mantel tests, and cluster, constrained and unconstrained ordination analysis, methods for (ensemble) suitability modelling and mapping.

title: Biofortification Priority Index (BPI),  a composite crop-specific index that ranks countries according to their suitability for investment in biofortification
narrative: The BPI accounts for the degree of production and consumption of each biofortifiable crop in a given country, and the deficiency level for the micronutrient with which the specific crop can be enriched. The BPI covers 128 countries in Africa, Asia, and Latin America and the Caribbean. It ranks countries according to their suitability for investment in biofortification inventions to be used by stakeholders with differing objectives.

title: A methodology for the landscape assessment of financial flows in Ghana and Indonesia
narrative: Methodology developed to explore existing financial flows in a landscape and their perceived impacts on previously defined landscape objectives. The methodology helps to define flows relevant to achieving objectives and worthwhile for in-depth studies on how to improve/scale up their impacts.
evidence_link: Manual at: https://www.tropenbos.org/resources/publications/the+landscape+assessment+of+financial+flows+-+a+methodology;  internal workshop report completed; available at: https://www.tropenbos.org/file.php/2325/ph laff training report ghana clean.pdf; case study report needs layout (improvement figures, Tables and references) before publication on TBI website;  available for internal use at: https://www.tropenbos.org/file.php/2324/ph ghana swjb laff report final clean.pdf;  draft lessons learned paper available for internal (FTA) revision: https://www.tropenbos.org/file.php/2323/laff  lessons learned clean 20200304.pdf.

title: CCAFS-validated animal nutrition model for methane emissions in Colombia:  a tool to develop low-emission livestock options and strategy
narrative: CIAT-CCAFS adapted an existing animal nutrition model (RUMINANT)  for the types of livestock, feed and nutritional qualities of feed under Colombian conditions to support Colombian policymakers to develop low emissions forage options

title: Modification of alternate wetting and drying (AWD), a proven irrigation strategy for rice production, to reduce the production of mosquitoes that transmit malaria
narrative: Alternate wetting and drying (AWD) was developed by IRRI and has been tested with farmers across Asia. The irrigation management strategy is an effective water saving strategy and helps reduce greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions, specifically methane. A4NH is testing how a modification of this strategy can reduce the production of mosquitoes that transmit malaria.

title: Suite of tools to help policymakers/stakeholders in West Africa to identify gaps in their national data systems to effectively track progress on nutrition and/or inform policy
narrative: These resources supply evidence that will support the use of nutrition data at country level in West Africa for tracking progress, setting priorities, informing policies and programs, guiding implementation, and monitoring intervention coverage for nutrition at national level.

title: "Three-legged stool" approach, a combined intervention to improve food safety in informal or traditional markets
narrative: The three aspects of the approach include (1) training and technologies, which include training, awareness raising and simple technologies such as disinfectants); (2) the enabling environment, meaning that regulatory authorities have to be on board with the intervention and there has to be some mechanism for institutionalisation and a means of quality assurance; and (3) motivation and incentives, which are essential but very context specific. The approach has potential to improve food safety at scale.

title: Africa Food Safety Index (AFSI), tool for African countries to measure, monitor, and benchmark progress on key food safety indicators
narrative:
The index was developed by a multidisciplinary team and validated by African Union country member states. A core team of experts translated the evidence into a quantitative numerical index, which breaks down into three sub-indices on food safety: 
•	Systems - existence of regulations, infrastructure, legal frameworks, and other institutional systems; 
•	Health - foodborne disease-related public health impacts; and
•	Trade - incidences of rejection, infractions relative to volume of trade and reasons.
https://au.int/sites/default/files/documents/33005-doc-prioritizing_food_safety_in_africa-eng.pdf

title: Climate Information Service Advisories for Major Field Crops of Bangladesh (Agvisely)
narrative: Agvisely is a climate information services tool that integrates real-time numerical weather forecast model outputs with crop management advisories and automatically provides localized advice to farmers and extension agents for a variety of crops in each of Bangladesh's 491 sub-districts.

title: Climate Information Service Advisories for Major Field Crops of Bangladesh ( "Agvisely") linked to the Department of Agricultural Extension (DAE) and the Bangladesh Meteorological Department (BMD) portals
narrative: The Department of Agricultural Extension (DAE) and the Bangladesh Meteorological Department (BMD), have endorsed linking of the application on "Climate Information Service Advisories for Major Field Crops of Bangladesh" in short "Agvisely" developed under the Climate Services for Resilient Development in South Asia (CSRD) Project to the DAE and BMD Web portal on an experimental basis.

title: FTA and PIM research showing the economic benefits of community forest concessions makes the case for continued community stewardship of 400,000 hectares of tropical forests in Guatemala
narrative:
FTA and PIM research highlighted the socioeconomic benefits of 12 community forest concessions in the Maya Biosphere Reserve in Peten, Guatemala. These findings provided the National Council for Protected Areas, in charge of the concessions, with the evidence
needed for revising the norms for forest concessions and renewing a first concession contract
(Cooperative Carmelita).

title: ETBW8003: a new wheat rust resistant elite line for Ethiopia
narrative:
High yielding, resistant to both stem and yellow rust
The elite lines were developed from ICARDA using the  shuttle breeding and key location yield trials. Thy were distributed to the national programs through international nursery system and tested in the respective countries regional and national trials. After verification trials by the respective national programs, the varieties were released and registered. The release was communicated to ICARDA accordingly.

title: Jawahir-19: a new wheat rust-resistant elite line for Afghanistan
narrative:
High yielding, rust resistance, drought tolerance 
The elite lines were developed from ICARDA using the  shuttle breeding and key location yield trials. Thy were distributed to the national programs through international nursery system and tested in the respective countries regional and national trials. After verification trials by the respective national programs, the varieties were released and registered. The release was communicated to ICARDA accordingly. I shared you the emails.

title: Mirdad 19: a new high yield, drought tolerant and rust resistant wheat variety for Afghanistan
narrative:
High yielding, rust resistance, drought tolerance 
The elite lines were developed from ICARDA using the  shuttle breeding and key location yield trials. Thy were distributed to the national programs through international nursery system and tested in the respective countries regional and national trials. After verification trials by the respective national programs, the varieties were released and registered. The release was communicated to ICARDA accordingly.

title: Sharq 19: a new high yield, drought tolerant and rust resistant wheat variety for Afghanistan
narrative: High yielding, rust reistance, drought tolerance

title: Imam 1: a new high yield,and heat tolerant wheat variety for Nigeria
narrative: high yielding and heat tolerant

title: Salvarti
narrative: CM829/ Cando cross-H25/5/F4-13/3/Arthur71/Lahn//Blk2/Lahn/4/Quarmal

title: Tugra, Yavuz
narrative: high yielding, rust resistant

title: LandscapeCPR: Business model for landscape restoration in Makueni County, Kenya
narrative:
Business model for landscape restoration called LandscapeCPR developed for Kenya (Makueni County). 
This business model was selected as one of 8 finalists of the Climate Lab. 
LandscapeCPR is a farm development and asset management model. Under this model, an asset manager develops investment opportunities for impact investors seeking financial, environmental, and social returns, at the same time operates equitably, transparently, and on a “do no harm basis”.

title: Cropping system sustainability tool 'CROSST' is an Excel-based tool assessing both agro-environmental and socio-economic impacts of Green Manure Cover Crop (GMCC) technologies
narrative: CROSST is an Excel-based tool assessing both agro-environmental and socio-economic impacts of Green Manure Cover Crop (GMCC) technologies. It has been piloted in Benin and Kenya

title: Application of new tool to map the economic and environmental suitability of solar irrigation in sub-Saharan Africa
narrative: Suitability of solar irrigation mapping tool tested in Mali, Ethiopia and Ghana, rolling out for sub-Saharan Africa. The tool enables mapping of areas suitable for solar irrigation based on a combination of natural resource, environmental and economic data.

title: Aerosol sampling in wet (informal) markets in Vietnam as an early warning screening for avian influenza viruses in poultry
narrative: ILRI researchers compared aerosol sampling (2-stage aerosol samplers were assembled on a tripod and run for 4 hours) with swab samples from chickens and ducks to determine the effectiveness of this strategy for early warning screening of poultry markets for novel influenza virus detection, such as H7N9.

title: Use of experiential games as a tool to help communities improve groundwater governance
narrative: Rapid decline in groundwater levels is a challenge in many areas in India. WLE/IFPRI and PIM partnered with the Foundation for Ecological Security (FES), a major Indian NGO, to develop and test the use of experimental games to strengthen groundwater governance. ICRISAT developed similar tools for managing surface water. These tools were so successful that they will now be scaled out to over 3700 communities involving some 245,000 households in at least six Indian states.

title: DATAR: a new application for Diversity Assessment Tool for agrobiodiversity and resilience
narrative: The Diversity assessment tool for agrobiodiversity and resilience (DATAR) tool allows local and national development organizations to integrate intra-specific crop, livestock and aquatic diversity into their decision making plans to improve on farm productivity for small holder farmers. The application has three main modules: agrobiodiversity data, agrobiodiversity interventions and agrobiodiversity impact.

title: Resource Recovery and Reuse business models have been incorporated into curricula of 8 universities in 6 countries
narrative: Based on extensive research, we developed curricula on resource recovery and reuse business models. These were incorporated into graduate programs in the 2019-2020 academic year at the following universities: Asian Institute of Tech. (Thailand), Birla Institute of Tech and Science (India), Makarere University (Uganda), the Open University of Sri Lanka, University of Moratuwa (Sri Lanka), Wayamba University of Sri Lanka, Technische Hochschule Köln University of Applied Sciences (Germany), Ghent University (Belgium).

title: Assessment of City Region Food System toolkit (RUAF/FAO)
narrative: The toolkit provides guidance on assessing and building sustainable city region food systems (CRFS). It supports: defining and mapping your city region; collecting data on your CRFS; and using a multistakeholder process to engage policymakers and other stakeholders to design a more sustainable and resilient CRFS.

title: Guideline on setting up Water User Associations and supporting institutions in pump based irrigation schemes in Myanmar
narrative: A guideline was developed explaining a step wise approach in setting up appropriate institutional structures in pump based irrigation schemes throughout the Central Dry Zone of Myanmar

title: A Knowledge brokering framework for integrated landscape management
narrative: The framework was developed based on an extensive global literature review. A Review was undertaken of opportunities and challenges in delivering decision support at landscape scale and the factors and conditions that can bring about more effective responses to decision support. Based on the literature review a decision-support tool was developed to assess tradeoffs among intervention options.

title: Global Soil Data Manager application
narrative:
The Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences (IVA) selected the Global Soil Data Manager application  (SSA-SDM) as one of the top 60 innovative ideas. The Global Soil Data Manager enables monitoring carbon stocks and measuring soil health cost effectively.
Global Soil Data Manager application: http://gsdm.ciat.cgiar.org.

title: Two new rice varieties released in Malawi
narrative: Lifuwu Rice Research Station in Salima, Malawi, released two new improved rice varieties in August this year for mass production by farmers nationwide (variety names to be confirmed).

title: A new rice variety with high yield released in Madagascar for low land ecology (FOFIFA 187)
narrative: The variety has high yield and salinity tolerance. The release name is FOFIFA 187

title: Agvisely.com
narrative: Agvisely is a climate information services tool that integrates real-time numerical weather forecast model outputs with crop management advisories and automatically provides localized advice to farmers and extension agents for a variety of crops in each of Bangladesh's 491 sub-districts. See: www.agvisely.com

title: Numerical weather forecast model driven wheat blast disease early warning system for Bangladesh and Brazil
narrative: The wheat blast disease early warning system for Bangladesh is a meteorologically-driven real-time early warning system that provides a risk assessment of blast outbreak risks by email and SMS to extension agents at a 17 km2 grid resolution for all wheat-growing areas in Bangladesh and parts of Brazil.

title: Numerical weather forecast model driven wheat blast disease early warning system for Bangladesh and Brazil
narrative:
The wheat blast disease early warning system for Bangladesh is a
meteorologically-driven real-time early warning system that provides a risk assessment of blast
outbreak risks by email and SMS to extension agents at a 17 km2 grid resolution for all
wheat-growing areas in Bangladesh and parts of Brazil. see: http://34.80.72.205/

title: WorldFlora: Standardize Plant Names According to World Flora Online Taxonomic Backbone (Version 1.1)
narrative: Standardization of plant names is a critical step in various fields of biology including biodiversity, biogeography and vegetation research. WorldFlora matches lists of plant names with a static copy from World Flora Online (WFO), an ongoing global effort of completing an online flora of all known vascular plants and bryophytes by 2020.

title: Priority Food Tree and Crop Food Composition Database for sub-Saharan Africa
narrative: The database (available at http://apps.worldagroforestry.org/products/nutrition/index.php/home) contains information on the composition of selected tree foods and crops with geographical focus on sub-Saharan Africa.
