title: New high yielding rice variety for irrigated ecology released in Madagascar (FOFIFA 188)
narrative: The variety has high yield and flood tolerance

title: New plant types possessing as many as 10 QTLs identified after profiling with 30 trait-based SNPs
narrative: A total of 1136 double haploids (DP) were profiled using 30 trait-based SNPs to elucidate inherent genetic attributes. Thirteen DH possessed 10 QTLs each while 56, 116, 182, 185 and 184 DH each possessed 9, 8, 7 6  and 5 QTLs respectively. These are good candidates to feed the parent development pipeline.
evidence_link: none as yet for Discovery research

title: A new rice variety with high yield for irrigated ecology (FOFIFA 189) in Madagascar
narrative: A high yielding and adaptable to the local environment rice variety is released in Madagascar. The release was made possible with combined effort of the Madagascar NARS , FOFIFA, and the National Varietal Release Committee (SOC)

title: A new high-yield rice for irrigated ecology (FOFIFA 190) in Madagascar
narrative: High yielding and early maturing variety is released with participatory varietal selection and with the evaluation by National Varietal Release Committee (SOC).

title: 3 New red rice candidate breeding lines are available for release in Madagascar
narrative: Several red rice breeding lines were evaluated at the Highlands of Madagascar for cold tolerance and adaptability. Three lines with good yield and grain quality are identified and currently presented for national evaluation with the intention for release.  This work is being carried out in collaboration with the NARS partner, FOFIFA and the National Varietal Release Committee (SOC).

title: 5 Cold tolerant and flood tolerant breeding lines are under national evaluation for release in Madagascar
narrative: breeding lines with Sub 1 gene introgression on the background of locally popular and cold tolerant variety (FOFIFA 160)  were under  field evaluation at Madagascar highlands. Now we have identified five candidate lines for release. These lines are under national evaluation following the requirements by the National Varietal Release Committee to facilitate their release.

title: Verification of F1 progenies to advance only successful crosses for all ecologies
narrative: More than 2200 F1 progenies from 183 individual crosses were genotyped with a panel of 24 widely distributed SNPs. Based on the genotypic profile of the parents, expected F1s are simulated for the purpose of comparing profiles and selecting true F1s.

title: New knowledge on major genetic switches that took place during the evolution of modern buffaloes.
narrative: The innovation is the new knowledge on genetic switches that occurred as part of buffalo evolution. This is a significant research finding, demonstrating that specific genomic fixation signals have persisted across river and swamp buffaloes and extended to taurine cattle, implying an ancient evolutionary event occurred before the speciation of buffalo and taurine cattle. Next users include population geneticists, bioinformaticians, and animal breeders.

title: Toolbox for monitoring, reporting, and verification (MRV) of greenhouse gass calculation in rice production
narrative: A toolbox has been built consisting of tools, guidelines, and templates for monitoring, reporting, and verification (MRV) of GHG calculation along the rice value chain. It is provided in form of an accessible and interactive platform which enables users to access the suitable tools/templates/guidelines according to their purposes. Part of the tools and guidelines are developed for use of the private sector while others mainly support governments in decision making and planning.

title: New information on the ancestry of modern South American chicken
narrative: The innovation is the new knowledge on the ancestry of modern South American chicken. Next users include population geneticists, bioinformaticians, and animal breeders. This research finding shows that modern-day South American chickens appear to have clear European and Asian contributions, and less so from Island Southeast Asia and the Pacific Islands. Furthermore, there is also some indication that South Asia has more genetic contribution to European chickens than any other Asian chicken populations.

title: New knowledge on the evolutionary history of domestic chickens
narrative: New insights, both signiciant and  novel, into the evolutionary history of domestic chickens are presented.  The utilised data also represents a valuable resource to facilitate ongoing genetic and functional investigations of chicken. This is a high altmetric publication (altmetric score of 419 on 24th Feb 2021).

title: New knowledge on the demographic history of sheep
narrative: New research findings identified genomic regions harbouring genes associated with distinct morphological and agronomic traits, which may be past and potential future targets of domestication, breeding, and selection. The results provide insights into the demographic history of sheep, and the data represents a valuable genomic resource for future genetic studies and improved genome-assisted breeding of sheep. Next users include population geneticists, bioinformaticians, and animal breeders.

title: Ovine single-nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) of the Y-chromosome male-specific region
narrative:
The SNPs on the ovine Y-chromosome could underpin the design of genetic tests for sex screening in sheep embryos. 
The research finding suggests that the first expansion of early domestic hair sheep and the later expansion of fat-tailed sheep occurred ∼11,800–9,000 years BP and ∼5,300–1,700 years BP, respectively, providing important insights into the history of migration and pastoralism of sheep across the Old World, associated with breeding goals during the Neolithic agricultural revolution.

title: New knowledge on how wild introgression shapes the adaptive genome landscape of native populations.
narrative: This research finding identifies clear signals of common introgression from wild relatives into sympatric domestic sheep populations, thereby increasing their genomic diversities. The wild introgressions provided beneficial genetic variants in native sheep populations, which were significantly associated with local climatic adaptation and resistance to pneumonia in sheep, enabling them to adapt to varying climatic and environmental conditions after domestication. The next users are animal breeders.

title: AutoMon-An IoT based irrigation advisory service in the Philippines
narrative: An Internet-of-Things based irrigation advisory service system (AutoMonPH) entails efficient water management, continuous monitoring, reporting and verification of water management practices, and a multi-stakeholder interface. AutoMonPH is targeted to offer a system-level solution for efficient management of irrigation water that will help the various stakeholders perform their responsibilities more efficiently and promptly while bringing all-important transparency to water governance along with providing almost real-time monitoring, reporting, and verification on water use.

title: New knowledge on the origin of domestication genes in goats
narrative: This research is the first to provide clear evidence of an ancient introgression event, ~7200 years ago, from a West Caucasian tur-like wild species to the ancestor of domestic goats. Better understanding of the origins of goat genome diversity may guide ex-situ conservation priorities, contribute to discovery of genetic variants for important economic/ecological traits, and feed into admixture analysis to determine an individual animal's breed composition. Next users include population geneticists, bioinformaticians, and animal breeders.

title: Direct seeding equipment for rice
narrative: We have entered a partnership with APV, the Austrian manufacturer of direct seeding equipment. APV became a member of the Direct Seeded Rice Consortium and donated two customized direct seeders to IRRI Philippines and IRRI Vietnam for verification in and adaptation to rice production conditions in Southeast Asia.
evidence_link: none as yet for Discovery research

title: Novel E-learning course on laser land leveling
narrative: To cope with the current issues of COVID-19 pandemic causing the restrictions of international travels and face-to-face trainings, we developed an e-learning module on laser land leveling which will be used for e-trainings. The learning approach was a mixed modality via synchronous and asynchronous teaching methods, consisting of synchronous sessions using Zoom and Google meet applications and the Self-paced sessions which is a purely asynchronous module that is hosted in IRRI Education’s Learning Management System).

title: Identification of causative mutation for the white coat phenotype in swamp buffalo.
narrative: The research findings, based on genomic analyses, show that an insertion in the ASIP (agouti signalling protein) gene is the causative mutation for the white coat phenotype in swamp buffalo (Bubalus bubalis). Phylogenetic analyses indicate the white buffalo-specific ASIP allele originated from a recent genetic transposition event. This information can be used by implementers of genomic-based breeding programs for swamp buffalo, taking into account farmers' coat colour preference for their animals.

title: New knowledge on divergent domestication traits in swamp and river buffalo
narrative: New research made a striking discovery that the divergent domestication traits between swamp and river buffaloes can be explained with recent selections of genes on social behaviour, digestion metabolism, strengths and milk production. Better understanding of the origins of Asian Buffalo genome diversity may  guide ex-situ conservation priorities, contribute to discovery of genetic variants for important economic/ecological traits, and feed into admixture analysis to determine an individual animal's breed composition.

title: Diversified and intensified rice-based cropping systems in the southern coastal zone of Bangladesh
narrative: Diversifying and intensifying the rice-based cropping systems in the southern coastal zone of Bangladesh is a priority to meet the food, feed, and fiber demand of an increasing population and changing climate. RICE is working in the region to catalyze an enabling environment for the early establishment of dry season crops by introducing rice varieties with a shorter growth duration than traditional rice in wet season, and empowering water management organizations for improving water governance.

title: New knowledge on how dairy cattle milk yield is affected by heat stress, in smallholder systems in East Africa.
narrative: This research finding is the first to demonstrate the negative effect of increased temperature and humidity on milk yields of dairy cattle kept in smallholder production systems in East Africa.  The next users of this information are implementers of genomic selection based breeding programs for dairy cattle, who wish to incorporate ability for cows to cope with increased temperature and humidity (heat stress) as part of their breeding objectives.

title: Identification of the most profitable combination of breed-type and management system for smallholder dairy cattle keepers in Senegal
narrative: First study on most profitable dairy-cattle breed type and management system for smallholder keepers in West Africa. Research indicated that the most net-beneficial and cost-beneficial dairy cattle enterprise that could be used by the smallholder farmers was to keep crossbred indigenous zebu by exotic Bos taurus animals under management standards that are considered good compared with local standards.

title: Newly developed index for genomic breeding value based selection of dairy cattle in Tanzania
narrative: Newly developed Index to allow selection of dairy cattle to be used for breeding, within Tanzania,  that improves the rate of milk production but keeps body weight constant.

title: Cold tolerant and nutritious red rice lines are identified for Madagascar Highlands
narrative: Breeding lines were screened at multiple location and red rice lines with higher nutritional value and adapted well to the local condition were identified. The selection was done through participatory varietal selection with local rice producers and consumers.  Three candidate lines have been submitted for release and are now under national testing by the National Varietal Committee (SOC).

title: Improved challenge model for contagious bovine pleuropnemounia (CBPP) using intranasal spray.
narrative: More realistic infection model to reproduce naturally-occurring disease. Infection with contagious bovine pleuropneumonia (CBPP) occurs via Mycoplasma-containing droplets and therefore requires close contact between animals. Current infection models based on intratracheal installation of mycoplasmas or in-contact infection are sub-optimal. This research tested the infection of adult cattle via aerosols containing live mycoplasmas. The results observed mirrored epidemiological models and the field situation, in which only a fraction of animals suffer from acute clinical disease post-infection.

title: Identification of the relationship between coat color and growth performances in Menz sheep
narrative: In Ethiopian community-based breeding programs (CBBPs), black coat colour sires are not selected regardless of their estimated breeding values. Consumer preference is also for white sheep and black animals are culled. The hypothesis was that farmers are culling superior genetic material solely due to coat colour, and research into the link between coat colour and productivity (growth) showed that this is indeed the case. Next users are researchers, development actors and government agencies implementing CBBPs.

title: Methodology to determine the resistance of sheep to infestation by ticks and infection by piroplasms under field conditions in Tunisia
narrative: Phenotyping for ticks and tick-borne diseases is novel in sheep. This innovation is a methodology for an exhaustive phenotyping of sheep using on-farm data to assess phenotypic variability for infestation by ticks and infection by piroplasms. It describes the traits (clinical, haematological, biochemical, molecular) and how they are measured and interpreted to identify prevalence and variability among sheep breeds in different agro-climatic zones, and also addresses phenotype clustering of animals for further genomic studies.

title: Breeding programs for goats in pastoral areas of Ethiopia
narrative: There are no sustainable sheep and goat breeding programs in pastoral production systems of sub-Saharan Africa. Designs which mimic those applied in crop-livestock systems have failed. ICARDA designed and implemented programs in 4 pastoralist communities of Ethiopia which consider the breeding objectives of the community, their mobility pattern, and resource base.

title: List of live attenuated vaccine candidates for African Swine Fever (ASF)
narrative: Ten different modified ASF viruses have been produced by gene deletion to be tested in animals.

title: List of candidate subunit vaccine antigens for African Swine Fever (ASF)
narrative: Identification of 10 genes based on cell mediated immune assays.

title: A method to measure rural household livelihood flexibility and assess its explanatory factors using longitudinal data
narrative: This method allows an empirical assessment of the effects of public interventions (including public expenditures) on household-level livelihood flexibility, and thus on the resilience of rural households against economic shocks. The tool is built on empirical methods for measuring the flexibility of a firm in switching between different production activities.

title: Using satellites to make Flood Index Insurance scalable and helping farmers survive floods in India and Bangladesh
narrative: In South Asia, there is still lack of comprehensive risk information data which is a key constraint in scaling insurance. Historical data is necessary to calculate the price of insurance, while current flood data is needed to verify claims. The availability of high-resolution satellite data has made it possible to develop a low-cost product to insure poor farmers against flooding in India and Bangladesh.

title: A novel NIR-image segmentation method for the precise estimation of above-ground biomass in rice crops.
narrative: A high-throughput phenotyping approach for the estimation of Above-Ground Biomass Dynamics (AGBD) using an unmanned aerial system. Multispectral imagery was acquired and processed by using the proposed segmentation method called GFKuts, that optimally labels the plot canopy based on a Gaussian mixture model, a Montecarlo based K-means, and a guided image filtering.

title: An unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) technology for estimating leaf N content in rice crops, from multispectral imagery
narrative: An unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) technology for estimating leaf N content in rice crops, from multispectral imagery. Our contribution is twofold: (i) a novel trajectory control strategy to reduce the angular wind-induced perturbations that affect image sampling accuracy during UAV flight, and (ii) machine learning models to estimate the canopy N via vegetation indices (VIs) obtained from the aerial imagery.

title: Selection of 6 lines from the reference panel of the global Rice Array for breeding pipelines
narrative: Evaluation of MAGIC lines under low radiation conditions for two different environments allowed the identification of 6 MAGIC lines with enhanced performance under low radiation conditions. These lines are now used in local breeding programs FEDEARROZ.

title: blast pathogens characterization in Colombia

Epidemiology and Control of Peste des Petits Ruminants (ECo-PPR) Study Design and Toolbox: A suite of tools toward understanding epidemiology and socio-economic impact of peste des petits ruminants (version 2),
narrative: A suit of gender sensitive survey tools for comprehensive, interdisciplinary data collection on peste des petits ruminants

title: Training YouTube channel for Epidemiology and Control of Peste des Petits Ruminants (ECo-PPR) toolbox
narrative: A series of pre-recorded training videos on how to conduct peste des petits ruminants surveys, in English and French. Designed for use by researchers, veterinary services and extension staff, and development organizations. Preliminary target countries are Senegal, Mali, Burkina Faso, Kenya, Ethiopia, Tanzania and Uganda, but it is available online to a global audience.

title: Field researcher manual for peste des petits ruminants (PPR) surveys, in French  and English
narrative: Detailed hands-on manuals for field researchers using the suite of survey tools for data collection on peste des petits ruminants (PPR).

title: Risk maps on ticks and tick-borne diseases in sheep in Tunisia
narrative: A model was built to predict habitat suitability of ticks of Rhipicephalus sanguineus and the pathogens transmitted

title: Risk maps on ticks and tick-borne diseases in dromedaries in Tunisia
narrative: Sero and molecular prevalence of Crimean Congo Haemorrhagic Fever (CCHF) virus and risk factors are documented according to the production system of dromedaries.

title: Training and coaching plan for Ethiopian animal health resource centre managers
narrative: A manual outlining the scope of the centres with guidance for managers on their role and how to ensure smooth operation

title: Guide to integrate community conversation training approach into Ethiopian extension system for gender responsive animal health management
narrative:
A guide for extension workers and researchers on how to roll out community conversation. This guide aims to integrate a gender-responsive and inclusive community conversation approach into animal health extension. The approach provides a platform for integrating gender considerations in animal health management.
The intended users of the guide are district-level animal health workers, but it can also be used by development organizations seeking to apply inclusive community engagement processes.

title: One Health community of practice monthly webinar series
narrative: A web-based platform bringing together different stakeholders with interests around operationalization of One Health in the field and its contribution to sustainable development. One Health is an intersectoral approach recognizing the close connection of the health of people to the health of animals and our shared environment. Compared to single sector approaches, One Health results in an added value of health and wellbeing of humans, animals and ecosystem including rangelands, financial savings, and sustained services.

title: A toolkit to guide facilitation of multi-stakeholder platforms in Ethiopia
narrative: This toolkit is meant to be used in supporting CRP Livestock partners and other users at the district and community level to establish and manage multi-stakeholder platforms (MSPs) effectively. It is presented in a simple way that provides the basic structure and steps of setting up a MSP. Each of the steps in the toolkit requires localized planning in the community and among the targeted stakeholders.

title: A practical guide to herd health management in pigs, dairy and small ruminants
narrative: A hands-on manual on how to implement herd health management practices for three livestock types

title: Improved sporozoite neutralization assay for East Coast fever
narrative: In vitro assay to help down-selection of candidate antigens and immunization methods. ILRI and partners have developed modified antibody tests for an important livestock disease in Africa, which aid in selection of candidate vaccine antigens and different types of experimental vaccine platforms.

title: Prototype of scenario dashboard based on MAGNET modelling for Bangladesh
narrative:
Through collaboration with WUR's MAGNET modelling team, a scenarios dashboard has been created to allow policy makers to access quantitative scenarios of possible future environmental management and governance futures for Bangladesh.
 An example was developed for a participatory process in Bangladesh that also includes Oxfam GB.

title: Improved climate-resilient rice varieties for Colombia - Fedearroz 67 for irrigated rice systems
narrative: Fedearroz 67, a variety for irrigated rice systems, was evaluated under different climatic conditions between Fedearroz (Rice growers association) and CIAT, which results indicated its resilience to climatic stress and increase in productivity.

title: Salinity tolerant Variety IR15T1030 (NSICRc 608) for the Philippines
narrative: New Salinity tolerant variety released in the Philippines.

title: Salinity tolerant Variety IR15T1094 (NSICRc 610) for the Philippines
narrative: Salinity tolerant rice variety recommended for the Philippines

title: Salinity tolerant Variety (NSICRc 606) for the Philippines
narrative: Salinity tolerant rice variety for the Philippines

title: Drought tolerant variety NSICRc 602 for the Philippines
narrative: Drought tolerant variety suitable for dry seeding released and available for uptake by the seed systems

title: Use of a positive deviance approach to inform farming systems redesign in Bihar, India
narrative:
We integrate the positive deviance approach with redesign of farming systems. Redesign allowed doubling indicator performance relative to the population mean. Indicators only improved when combining high livestock density and crop practices.
Redesign is based on best practices present within community and therefore viable. Farmers' feedback was obtained in focus groups to inform a new cycle of redesign.

title: New typology of women’s strategies to strengthen their managerial decision-making power in wheat in India
narrative: Potential strategies range from a zero point (no strategy, the woman is fully immersed in the doxa that men take all decisions) through to the emergence of a new doxa (women take all decisions). Constructing a typology is valuable, because it allows researchers to lift what women say about their lives and how they set goals out of the realm of the merely anecdotal and to start systematizing them in a logical way.

title: Phenoi software to analyse drone and satellite images
narrative: To accelerate image processing, an automated image-analysis framework called  Pheno-i was developed to extract plot level vegetation indices/canopy metrics. Multiple linear regression models were constructed at different key growth stages of rice and other CIAT mandate crops, using ground-truth data and vegetation indices obtained from a RGB and multispectral sensor.

title: Native trait deployment lines for rice
narrative: Critical genes are often absent from elite material, hence breeders are unable to leverage the value of those genes in the breeding program.  The native trait deployment products move these high-value genes into high-value elite material, which breeders can use to introduce into their breeding programs. Deployment products are at a very high standard of genetic quality, with RPP >97% and introgressions <0.125% of the genome size.

title: Improved mid-density genotyping platforms for breeding and mapping
QTL profiles of high-value genes in rice
narrative: Profiles of high-value genes found in elite material developed based on interrogation of marker data.  Algorithms developed to calculate QTL profiles based on a variety of input data, including genome sequences, mid-density platforms and Intertek trait SNPs.
evidence_link: none as yet for Discovery research

title: Unified breeding pipeline for trait development in rice
narrative: A unified pipeline for pre-breeding activities to connect diversity in the genebank to elite breeding programs was developed.  This follows a stage/gate system to ensure rigorous development of traits, ensuring the information and products needed to use these effectively in a breeding program are developed and at an appropriate standard of quality.

title: NOISYmputer, an algorithm for imputation of low-depth sequencing data in bi-parental populations of diploid species
narrative: The NOISYmputer algorithm allows data correction and missing data imputation of data matrices derived from whole-genome sequencing a low depth (typically 1X). It outperforms the existing similar algorithms (FSFhap, LB-Impute, Genotype-Corrector) thanks to its several improved filtering routines. This allows more precise analysis of recombination maps and QTL detection/localization.

title: Knowledge on population structure of the blast fungus in Africa
narrative: Collection of strains and characterization of the population structure of Pyricularia oryzae in SubSaharan Africa (West, East, Madagascar)

title: Compendium of indicators for food system assessments
narrative: The Compendium suggests a set of indicators for five domains within food systems (Diets, Consumer Behaviour, Food Environment, Food Supply, and Food System Drivers). For each indicator, a definition and a description of how to calculate the indicator is provided, including a description of what data is needed. This resource can be especially useful for researchers assessing dietary aspects of the food system.

title: Metrics for conceptualizing sustainable diets at local level in Vietnam
narrative: A conceptual framework for sustainable diets that is locally relevant to Vietnam, which includes 235 unique, measurable indicators across eight domains: (1) food production, (2) food processing and distribution, (3) food loss and waste, (4) food access and consumption, (5) food and water safety, (6) nutrition, (7) sociopolitical context, and (8) environmental impact.

title: World Index for Sustainability and Healthy (WISH), a globally applicable index for healthy diets from sustainable food systems
narrative: WISH measures two complex multidimensional concepts, diet quality and environmental sustainability, in one scoring system. WISH is based on the EAT-Lancet planetary health diet, a global reference diet for adults. Thirteen food groups are scored between 0 and 10, based on their association with disease and impact on environmental indicators.

title: Tool for collecting food intake data to draw conclusions about diet quality
narrative: The Diet Quality-Questionnaire (DQ-Q) is a survey module for capturing population-level food group consumption data, developed within the Global Diet Quality Project. The 5-minute list-based module asks yes/no questions (in the local language) about consumption of a series of sentinel foods that correspond to pre-defined food groups. It was developed to improve the reliability and standardization of diet quality data collection and is the first effort to approach the formulation of list-based questions systematically.

title: Tool to monitor fruit and vegetable intake
narrative: The tool is intended for researchers. The tool consists of questions on consumption of sentinel fruits and vegetables in the previous 24 hours (yes/no). It goes along with guidelines how to use the information from the questionnaire to arrive at indicators of fruit and vegetable intake such as percentage of persons consuming fruit, vegetables, fruit/vegetable vis a vis consumption of other food groups.

title: Methodology for assessing the food environment as part of research on food systems for healthier diets
narrative: Compiled inventory of definitions, typologies, and assessment methods related to research on the food environment and its impacts on consumer choices and healthy diets in low- and middle-income countries. Methods can be applied in food systems design and testing of food system innovations.

title: Comprehensive set of metrics for global food system analysis
narrative: A comprehensive set of metrics to characterize food systems, set meaningful goals, track food system performance, and evaluate the impacts of food system interventions, all of which are necessary in any context to effectively implement food systems approaches for healthier diets.

title: A fast, efficient and high-throughput procedure involving laser microdissection and droplet digital Reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) for tissue-specific expression profiling of rice roots
narrative: We optimized an approach combining laser microdissection (LM) and droplet digital RT-PCR (Reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction; RT-PCR) for high-throughput identification of tissue-specific expression profiles. The developed protocol enables rapid (within 3 days) extraction of high-quality RNA from root tissues with a low contamination rate.

title: Promising lines were released for irrigated lowland conditions in Bangladesh
narrative: Two promising lines BRRI Dhan 97 (IR83484-3-B-7-1-1-1) and BRRI Dhan99 (HHZ5-DT20-DT2-DT1) were released for irrigated lowland conditions in Bangladesh

title: Mainstreaming of participatory systems modeling
narrative: Papers written to mainstream more general methods (three papers submitted in 2020; accepted and in press early 2021)

title: Protocol for durum wheat milling into semolina
narrative: Due to the intrinsic characteristics of durum wheat kernels (harder than the bread wheat kernels) the ideal durum wheat milling output is semolina rather than flour. For this reason, during 2020, a protocol for the production of high-quality semolina (right particle size, low ash content, and low starch damage), was implemented in the laboratory. This method will allow more effective analysis of the durum wheat technological quality.

title: Measuring women’s decision making: Indicator choice and survey design experiments from cash and food transfer evaluations in Ecuador, Uganda and Yemen
narrative: Women’s decision making indicators are widely used as a proxy for empowerment, though insufficient attention is given to measurement. Researchers scrutinized variations in indicator construction using survey experiments undertaken in the context of transfer programs in Ecuador, Yemen, and Uganda. Findings show that small variations in indicators can lead to significant differences in rankings of women’s voice in decision making and change conclusions on whether programs have impacts on decision making.

title: Development of Maize Seed Production Technology
narrative: The Methodologies developed will enhance the use of CIMMYT’s tropical parental inbred lines, by breeders and seed producers working in both the private and public sector in the IMIC-LatAm influence region, but also in areas with similar environmental characteristics around the world

title: OneRice breeding strategy
narrative: A unified breeding strategy as an end-to-end framework for IRRI in creating market preferred varieties for all concerned ecologies,  leveraging centralized pre-breeding, central service platform, NARES collaborations in advanced testing, and catalyzing the seed system for effective varietal replacement.

title: Gender at scale (feminization of agriculture project and Livestock Master Plans)
narrative: Gender research work has to date been conducted mainly at household and community levels; ILRI is now working at policy level. A Livestock Master Plan (LMP) is a five-year sector investment plan to guide the development of a country’s sustainable livestock sector, intended to positively impact the economy of the country or state in which it’s carried out. So far, gender has not been sufficiently included and this work contributes to meet this gap.

title: Using community conversations on animal health as a Gender Transformative Approach
narrative: Test effectiveness of community conversations in changing gender relations and practices on  zoonoses in Ethiopia
evidence_link: Mulema, A.A et al  2020. Clapping with two hands: Transforming gender relations and zoonotic disease risks through community conversations in rural Ethiopia. Human Ecology 48: 651–663.  https://hdl.handle.net/10568/110213

title: Women's Empowerment in Livestock Business Index (WELBI) tool
narrative: The pre-existing tool Women's Empowerment in Livestock Index (WELI) targets livestock producers; this new tool is about women involved in livestock businesses

title: A mobile app for recording children's food consumption and Mid-Upper Arm Circumference data in Kenya
narrative: New tool and mobile application that reduces the cost of collecting and disseminating nutrition and health information, for better reporting and decision making

title: Process to better involve men in social and behavioural change communication, Rwanda
narrative: Training approaches that better engage men in nutrition issues

title: Reinventing Rice Breeding: One pipeline: Two systems
narrative: Direct seeded rice as a method of crop establishment continues to offer a robust, water and labor-saving alternative. The breeding programs of IRRI are transitioning to establishing the crop through a dry DS system. In 2020 a whitepaper describing the details of the process. This document was used to develop a proposal named"mechanization to enable direct seeding in rice breeding operations" which was successfully funded through the CtEH grant with the help of EiB.

title: Unite for a Better Life, a gender-transformative educational intervention targeting prevention of intimate partner violence and HIV risk behaviors in Ethiopia
narrative: A gender-transformative educational intervention targeting prevention of intimate partner violence and HIV risk behaviors in Ethiopia was developed and demonstrated to be effective in a large-scale randomized trial.

title: Livestock productivity module for the Rural Household Multi-Indicator Survey (RHoMIS)
narrative: This is a new module for inclusion in RHoMIS, developed in 2020

title: COVID-19 module for the Rural Household Multi-Indicator Survey (RHoMIS)
narrative: The new module was created and surveys conducted - most using online means

title: Pig Smart integrated extension system (combining genetics, health, feed and environmental components) for the pig value chain in Uganda
narrative: The system is being designed as a way to integrate research interventions from different technical components (feed, health, genetics, environment)

title: Method to estimate global food waste using an energy gap approach and affluence elasticity
narrative: New approach to obtain quantitative estimates of the link between food waste and consumer affluence. Using easily available consumer expenditure or GDP data, the method provides a way of obtaining comparable food waste estimates for countries without detailed surveys.

title: Televised video promoting consumption of fruits and vegetables to urban households in Ethiopia
narrative: Short video covers messages on the World Health Organization's recommended consumption of fruits and vegetables, i.e., at least two servings of fruit and three servings of vegetables per day. The messages mimic current practices of Ethiopia's public health extension workers and features local characters.

title: Consumer-oriented food system innovations to improve fruit and vegetable intake in Vietnam and Nigeria
narrative: The interventions include (1) retailer innovations to increase consumer accessibility to fruits and vegetables (F&V), (2) behavior change communication to increase acceptability of F&V, and (3) vouchers designed to reduce the cost of purchasing selected F&V. The approach is unique because it is testing strategies to overcome three barriers to healthy diets (accessibility, acceptability, and affordability).

title: Across-country genetic evaluation of dairy cattle in Sub-Saharan Africa
narrative: This innovation is a genomic tool (single-nucleotide polymorphism, or SNP, panel) plus methodological approach that enables across-country genetic ranking of dairy cattle in East Africa. This can provide a platform for accelerated genetic progress through selection and germplasm exchange between countries in sub-Saharan Africa. Further, the SNP panel (or more specifically the genomics data generated from this) will enable East African dairy cattle to be included in international dairy cattle genetic evaluations.

title: Cash transfers increasing trust and enhancing informal support networks between households in Tanzania
narrative: This publication provides evidence that cash transfers increase certain types of assistance between households (e.g. childcare) and perceived levels of trust among community members. These results suggest that formal cash transfer programs do not necessarily crowd out informal safety nets and that they may in fact boost trust and support between households.

title: Recommendations for agriculture programs on how to measure impacts on diets and nutrition
narrative: A4NH strategic brief frames how agriculture programs can be designed and evaluated to reduce forms of malnutrition and outlines key components of successful implementation and measurement of impacts of such programs.

title: New evidence on the aging trend in African farming and the need for an effective strategy to make it more profitable
narrative: Work by IFPRI and MSU sheds new light on the landscape of the African labor force by debunking the myth of Africa’s ageing farmers and demonstrating that Africa does not have a “youth problem” but rather faces the broader challenge of promoting inclusive economic development. Instead of focusing on keeping young people in farming, a more effective strategy would prioritize resourcing the millions of rural youth already engaged in farming to make farming more profitable.

title: Series of 10 double-duty actions that can be implemented in the areas of health services, social safety nets, education, and food systems to address malnutrition in all its forms
narrative: “Double duty” actions tackle all forms of malnutrition, including undernutrition, obesity, and diet-related non-communicable diseases (NCDs). Such actions are particularly important in countries undergoing rapid nutrition transition and food system modernization. Ten opportunities are outlined and provide useful guidance to decisionmaker.

title: COVID-19 Policy Response Portal
narrative: The COVID-19 Policy Response Portal captures policy responses of governments to the pandemic, including population restrictions, social protection, trade, health, fiscal, and monetary measures in 33 countries. The date of the responses is included, enabling the information to be used to study the effects of the responses. In addition, the portal provides information on the different types of institutional collaborations used by governments to manage the pandemic.

title: 24-hour dietary recall method for use in adolescents in Burkina Faso
narrative: The 24-hour dietary recall method is frequently used for dietary assessment. Data on dietary nutrient intakes of adolescents in low‐ and middle‐income countries is lacking partly due to the absence of validation studies of this method in adolescents. A4NH researchers, with partners, conducted a validation study of the 24‐hour recall compared with observed weighed records (OWR) in adolescents and concluded that the method can be used in adolescents.

title: Suite of tools for measuring cost and cost-effectiveness of multisectoral nutrition strategies and interventions
narrative:
A comprehensive set of data collection tools for estimating financial and economic costs of nutrition-sensitive interventions delivered
through multisectoral projects. Tools can also be used for general financial budget projections as part of scaling up nutrition-sensitive interventions. Designed so that they can be easily used alongside planned or ongoing process or impact evaluations. This is part of the Strengthening Economic Evaluation for Multisectoral Nutrition Strategies (SEEMS-Nutrition) initiative of which A4NH researchers from IFPRI are participating.

title: "How are we doing?", a tool for participatory monitoring and adaptive learning in multi-stakeholder fora
narrative: This tool is designed to be used by multistakeholder fora participants to foster better communication, mutual understanding and adaptive learning towards truly inclusive processes.

title: High-value data product and replicable analytic pipeline for cross-cutting research, demonstrating value of Open and FAIR data: Profitability of fertilizer use in Africa
narrative: This product used the GARDIAN data portal to quantify the profitability of intensifying maize production across Sub-Saharan Africa (SSA) using machine learning models based on 12,081 trial observations that estimate local crop responses to fertilizer. This work suggests that agricultural intensification in SSA could be supported by lowering the cost of fertilizer, by further developing complementary agro-ecological approaches to improve soil fertility and yield response to fertilizer; and by investing in more profitable non-staple crops.

title: High-value data product and analytic pipeline demonstrating value of Open and FAIR data: enabling researchers to assess climate risk profiles and crop suitability at national scale.
narrative: This high computational demand work employed CG Labs to develop climate risk profiles for agricultural value chains in developing countries at the national and subnational level, providing a climate and vulnerability analysis of the Green Innovation Centres (GIC) target commodity value chains. The goal is to foster awareness of risks and adaptation priorities in the selected value chains and inform climate investments and planning through the recommendations on priority innovations to manage climate risks.

title: Mid-density, low cost genotyping platform "DArTAG" for use in genomic selection of wheat.
narrative: A new mid-density genotyping platform in collaboration with EIB and DArT in wheat. This genotyping platform is of low cost (10USD including DNA extraction). The version 1 SNP panel included 2417 SNPs and shows high reproducibility and low number of missing values. The platform is mainly to be used in Genomic selection

title: Remote sensing-based tool to assess nitrogen levels in farmers fields, to support farmers' stover+fertilizer use/management
narrative: Proper nitrogen management is crucial to conservation agriculture. Significant yield (GY) increases are achieved when combining residues with N fertilizer application. Quantifying the optimal quantity of stover to incorporate as residue cover will provide greater yield and economically benefit farmers. MAIZE researchers demonstrated the potential of remote sensing tools at leaf and canopy scale to predict grain yield and assess leaf nitrogen content, to help adjust N fertilizer inputs for optimizing grain yield.

title: Map Egypt: An online database for improving food and nutrition security in Egypt
narrative: MAP Egypt is a monitoring tool that keeps track of agricultural development projects in relation to the subnational socioeconomic context in Egypt. The goal of the tool is to improve agricultural project planning, coordination and effectiveness. MAP Egypt helps the Government, development partners, researchers and other interested parties to gain a quick overview of the state of agriculture in Egypt at the aggregate and project level.

title: Development of  9 (Nine) synthetic varieties for the tropical lowlands of Mexico
narrative: Nine tropical lowland synthetic varieties were selected for their competitive yield and favorable agronomic characteristics. These varieties can be scaled to public or private seed system units to carry out seed producibility research trials

title: Development of 9 (Nine) maize hybrids with high yield potential and competitive agronomic characteristics for the highlands, mid-altitudes and lowlands of Mexico.
narrative: Nine maize hybrids (three tropical lowland, four subtropical and two highland hybrids) were selected for their competitive yield and favorable agronomic characteristics

title: Development of 72 maize hybrids with high yield potential and competitive agronomic characteristics for the highlands, mid-altitudes and lowlands of Mexico
narrative: 72 maize hybrids (40 tropical lowland, nine subtropical and 16 highland hybrids) were advanced to next testing stage in a greater number of localities for their competitive yield and favorable agronomic characteristics.

title: Development of 23 maize hybrids with high yield potential and competitive agronomic characteristics for the highlands, mid-altitudes and lowlands of Mexico.
narrative: 23 maize hybrids (ten tropical lowland, eight subtropical and five highland hybrids) were advanced to next testing stage in a greater number of localities for their competitive yield and favorable agronomic characteristics.

title: 48 CGIAR-derived elite maize varieties released by MAIZE national partners globally in 2020
narrative: Development and deployment of elite stress-tolerant maize varieties, with enhanced genetic gain using novel genetic diversity and tools.

title: Novel phenotyping method to assess the glycemic index (GI) of cooked rice samples
narrative: We have developed novel phenotyping method to assess the glycemic index (GI) of cooked rice samples. Using this technology, we have mined diversity lines and breeding lines to estimate the GI value. By linking genome-phenome data, we have defined the genetics for lowering the GI. Using this technology, we have identified low-GI breeding lines.

title: Identification of new peloteopic loci conferring resistance to Leaf Rust and Yellow Rust in wheat on chromosome 1B in "Arabelu" and "Mucuy" populations
narrative: New pleiotropic loci conferring resistance to Leaf Rust and Yellow Rust has been identified close to the Lr46 region on chromosome 1BS and this is a new region identified in two biparental populations and marker development is underway

title: identification of new genomic regions conferring leaf rust résistance in durum wheat
narrative:
1BL, 2B, 5BL, and 6BL regions associated with Leaf Rust resistance
Lr46 was the most significant and consistent gene/locus in all populations and environments
6BL is a new leaf rust resistance locus in CIMMYT durum wheat lines

title: Efficient molecular markers for screening wheat grain arabinoxylan content (dietary fiber) developed
narrative: Arabinoxylans (AX) are the major components of dietary fibers in wheat grains. Dietary fiber consumption across the world is on average well below the recommended daily intake. By knowing the genetic control of AX content it would be possible to more easily select wheat lines with higher amounts of AX. The significant 1BL region identified here was already identified in other studies using different germplasms.

title: PIM models show that donors must double aid to end hunger
narrative: Modelling by PIM and partners shows that an additional investment of USD 14 billion from donors and USD 19 billion from developing countries each year between now and 2030 could lift 490 million people out of hunger, reducing the prevalence of undernourishment below 3% in every country. This increased investment, if used effectively, could also double the incomes of 545 million small-scale farmers and maintain greenhouse gas emissions in agriculture below the Paris agreement commitments.

title: COVID-19 Food Trade Policy Tracker
narrative: The COVID-19 pandemic has prompted some national governments to restrict food exports, which can have negative consequences for vulnerable people in food-importing countries, The COVID-19 Food Trade Policy Tracker provides updated information on export restrictions affecting international food trade. Export restriction data originate mostly from news articles verified with official government sources, while other datasets are used to create impact indicators for the export restrictions.

title: Methodology for measuring postharvest quantity and quality losses
narrative: The methodology measures the nature and quantity of postharvest losses, both physical and economic, across the value chain. It has been applied to different commodities in a wide array of countries. A set of surveys to measure the extent of food losses have been designed to capture detailed information about the different processes at each node of the value chain and quantify the corresponding losses.

title: Breeding methods innovation: Kompetitive Allele-Specific PCR (polymerase chain reaction) markers associated with wheat phenotypic traits were developed.
narrative:
Kompetitive Allele-Specific Polymerase Chain Reaction(KASP) marker development and validation: 
A total of 61 KASP markers associated with phenotypic traits were developed based on the results of previously conducted GWAS analysis (GWAS markers with high heterozygosity was discarded: >10%). A total of 290 bi-parental lines were genotyped using 49 KASP markers. A total of 238 diversity lines (facultative and spring lines) were genotyped using all 61 KASP markers.

title: Methods to reduce fatigue-induced quality reduction in household surveys tested in Ghana
narrative: In household surveys, primary respondents are often asked to report first on their own work activities and then on those of family members. PIM research in Ghana showed that response fatigue leads to undercounting of labor activities by 8%, with women and youth much more impacted than older adults. Ways to solve this issue include randomization of the household order, interviewing each family member personally, and encouraging consultation with available family members during the interview.

title: Machine learning innovations for rapid assessments in wheat and rice systems in South Asia.
narrative:
Machine learning innovations for rapid characterization and assessment of yield, resilience, and greenhouse gasses
in South Asia's rice and wheat systems

title: 21 high-value QTLs, explaining at least 10 % of the phenotypic variance for percent grain chalkiness in rice
narrative: 21 high-value QTLs, explaining at least 10 % of the phenotypic variance for percent grain chalkiness (PGC) were identified. Combined epistasis and (genome-wide association studies) GWAS were applied to dissect the genetics of the complex chalkiness trait, and its regulatory cascades were validated using gene regulatory networks. Based on haplotype mining only a few modern rice varieties confounded with a lower chalkiness, and they possess several PGC quantitative trait loci QTLs.

title: Novel haplotypes that underly higher higher head rice yield (HRY) in rice
narrative:
We identified novel haplotypes that underly higher  head rice yield (HRY) and its association peaks exceeding the threshold (–log10P>5) for HRY on chromosome 3 (30.09 Mb), chromosome 6 (27.57–27.62 Mb), chromosome 8 (25.05–25.20 Mb),
and chromosome 11 (25.78–25.79) under controlled drying conditions, with a narrow-sense heritability h2=0.76. The novel haplotypes confer to associate with higher HRY found in rare gene bank accessions but were missing in breeding lines except IR64.

title: Educational videos to raise awareness of risks and transmission of antimicrobial resistance (AMR) and intersection with livestock for Kenya
narrative: These short videos explain in Swahili and English what individuals can do to prevent antimicrobial resistance (AMR). They were co-created by A4NH researchers from ILRI and the University of Liverpool through a consultative exercise and as part of a United Kingdom Biotechnology and Biological Sciences Research Council/Global Challenges Research Fund public engagement grant.

title: New value-chain approaches for food supply- transformation and the future of cereal-based agri-food systems
narrative: Foresight approaches to better understand the dynamics and consequences of rural transformation that are not fully captured in simulation models. This approaches  used the IMPACT model findingson future global R&D scenarios and looked at the limitations through the lens of rural transformation analysis across regions. IMPACT model results alone regarding what kinds of research investments would best support the changes that will improve livelihoods of the poor in the studied target geographies.

title: Improved forecasting of impacts of climate change and targeted technology development
narrative: The foresight team strives to generate new methods and approaches to better assess and forecast the effects of climate change and weather extremes

title: Minimal tillage and intermittent flooding, rice irrigation strategies to reduce the production of mosquitoes that transmit malaria
narrative: Minimal tillage and intermittent flooding are water smart technologies for efficient irrigation water use in dryland areas. The practices are being adapted and tested to see how it can reduce mosquito breeding in rice fields. Irrigation systems have been identified as one of the factors promoting malaria disease around agricultural farms in sub-Saharan Africa. Adoption of improved water management strategies in rice cultivation may help to reduce malaria cases among humans.

title: Host Decoy Trap, alternative technique for evaluating the effect of vector control measures on disease carrying insects such as black flies and mosquitoes, in African settings
narrative: The Host Decoy Trap (HDT) combines olfactory, visual, and thermal stimuli to mimic a blood host, attracting insects to a trap where they are stuck to a strong adhesive. Researchers from IITA are assessing how well the HDT works in Cameroon to attract blackflies, which spread several diseases including river blindness.

title: A product quality assurance mechanism for agricultural inputs for Uganda
narrative: In Uganda, the quality of hybrid maize seed and glyphosate herbicide is often low due to counterfeiting and adulteration. Unable to confirm the authenticity of these products, farmers only accept to pay low prices for them, pushing higher priced, high-quality products out of the market. A product quality assurance scheme proved effective to increase the quality and adoption rates of these agricultural inputs by reducing information asymmetries.

title: Volunteer farmer trainer approach in Eastern Africa
narrative: The volunteer farmer trainer (VFT) approach is a type of farmer-to-farmer extension which involves the provision of training by farmers to farmers, often through the creation of a farmer trainers' structure. An impact evaluation of a VFT training program led by ICRAF in Uganda showed that the program improved farmers’ knowledge of improved dairy farming practices as well as dairy productivity and revenues.

title: Mechanisms to improve coordination in extension services delivery in Kenya
narrative: In Kenya as in many African countries, implementation of decentralized and pluralistic policies for the provision of extension services has led to a coordination challenges between providers, resulting in reduced effectiveness. A PIM study guided by the relational coordination theory and carried out in partnership with the Kenyan Forum for Agricultural Advisory Services provides insights for strengthening coordination in extension services delivery.

title: Dynamic Agricultural Household Bio-economic Simulator (DAHBSIM)
narrative: DAHBSIM is a dynamic, bio-economic model of agricultural households designed to be applied to a rural, developing-country setting for the purpose of addressing questions around biophysical constraints to on-farm agricultural productivity and whole-farm implications of alternative strategies to sustainable agricultural intensification. The model links socio-economic and biophysical aspects in order to better illustrate the environmental and human welfare implications of different agricultural production practices.

title: Capacity Development for Agriculture Innovation: A Practitioners’ Guidebook to a Systems Approach
narrative: This interactive guidebook brings together tools and resources to help practitioners design and implement capacity development activities with an innovation systems approach in mind. It offers practical applications from experiences that will enable agricultural innovation systems actors - and development practitioners more widely - to better identify capacity development opportunities and activities that continuously improve innovation capabilities within value chains, agrifood systems, and agricultural innovation systems.

title: Wheat Yield Collaboration Yield Trial (WYCYT) nursery and International Wheat Yield Partnership Yield Potential Trait Experiment networks released in 2020
narrative: A series of novel high yielding wheat lines based on strategic crosses with genetically diverse parents are made available to WHEAT partners.

title: Agroecological management Practices against Fall Armyworm for cereal systems in Bangladesh
narrative: Cereal Systems Initiative for South Asia-CSISA-, along with the Bangladesh Wheat and Maize Research Institute (BWMRI) and the Bangladesh Agricultural Research Institute (BARI) are actively field-testing the efficacy of intercropping methods on Fall Armyworm (FAW) suppression and reduction in crop damage across a range of agroecological environments in Bangladesh. This work is part of a larger project collaboration with FAO's FAW Agroecological Management of FAW expert research group.

title: Framework for Small-Scale Irrigation and Women's Empowerment in Ghana
narrative: The framework integrates the following concepts related to empowerment—agency, resources, and achievements—and describes the relationships between these components. Women’s empowerment in this framework is conceptualized as an iterative process by which individuals improve their ability to make strategic life choices (agency) by utilizing resources, leading to improvements in well-being outcomes (achievements), such as food and nutrition security, and/or economic and social status.

title: Application of the Net-Map tool to the diffusion of small-scale irrigation in Ghana and Ethiopia
narrative: Net-Map is a facilitation or interview technique that helps people understand, visualize, discuss, and improve situations in which many different actors influence outcomes. By creating Influence Network Maps, individuals and groups can clarify their own view of a situation, foster discussion, and develop a strategic approach to their networking activities. More specifically, Net-Map helps participants to determine what actors are involved in a given network, how they are linked, and their level of influence.

title: Subsurface water retention membrane (SWRM)/ Soil Water Retention Technology (SWRT) to restore and use sustainably, lands with sandy soils
Agrobiodiversity index for supporting public and private sector decision-making on biodiversity in food systems, for healthy diets, sustainable production, and conservation
"¿Como vamos?", a tool to support indigenous women's participation in the governance of their territories in the Peruvian Andes and Amazon
narrative: The tool facilitates adaptive monitoring in support of the participation of indigenous women in the governance of their communal territories. Published in 2020, it is the product of a collaboration between CIFOR and the National Organization of Andean and Amazonian Indigenous Women of Peru (ONAMIAP). The tool was designed with contributions of indigenous leaders and women representing different levels of government, civil society, and academia.

title: Tool for enhancing social inclusion through local dialogues on natural resource management
narrative: This tool offers guidance on a tested approach for enhancing social inclusion through natural resource management (NRM). It can be used to accompany processes of community engagement and community-based or -led deliberations on NRM. As processes of social exclusion are historically and contextually rooted, the tool is not meant to be overly prescriptive. Rather, it draws attention to the importance of representation, process and content in fostering inclusion in NRM or other community affairs.

title: Evidence-based assessment report outlining seven drivers of zoonotic disease outbreaks and 10 evidence-based recommendations for governments
narrative: High-profile evidence-based assessment report on the risk of future zoonotic outbreaks, focusing specifically on the environmental side. The report, co-authored by the International Livestock Research Institute (ILRI) and the United Nations Environment Program (UNEP), provides policymakers with a better understanding of the context and nature of potential future zoonotic disease outbreaks, including the COVID-19 pandemic, and offers a set of practical recommendations that can help them prevent and respond to future disease outbreaks.

title: Stripe rust associated genotyping-by-sequencing markers for marker-assisted selection and genomic profiles of 52,067 wheat breeding lines for stripe rust associated markers.
narrative: Stripe rust associated genotyping-by-sequencing markers were identified, providing a significant leap in broadening our understanding of the common genetic basis of stripe rust resistance across environments. The genomically characterized lines create new opportunities for genomics-assisted wheat breeding and are a substantial advancement in our knowledge of the stripe rust associated allelic composition of wheat lines, enabling breeders to select parents, design strategic crosses for resistance and eliminate lines with low to no favorable alleles.

title: Blast associated genotyping-by-sequencing markers for marker-assisted selection and genomic profiles of 4,143 wheat breeding lines for the 2NS translocation.
narrative: Multi-environment genome-wide association mapping for blast resistance enabled identification of consistent blast associated genotyping-by-sequencing markers and provided valuable insights into the genetic architecture of resistance against different isolates of MoT in Bolivia and Bangladesh.The fingerprints of 4,143 lines for the 2NS translocation provided excellent insights into the increasing frequency of the translocation over years and emphasized the urgent need to identify novel non-2NS sources of blast resistance

title: Participatory Prospective Analysis to understand the implications of tenure reform scenarios for the forestry sector and communities in forested landscapes.
narrative: Participatory Prospective Analysis (PPA) aims to help decision makers understand the key drivers, challenges and consequences of tenure security policies and reforms in the forestry sector and for communities in forested landscapes. Through participatory meetings, stakeholders identify and develop a range of tenure security scenarios and elaborate actions in response to each scenario while gaining confidence about their capacity to understand and better their own futures.

title: "Cellphilms" and "Photovoice" tools to strengthen women's agency in climate-resilient strategies in Uganda
narrative: Farmers were provided with mobile phones to take photos ("Photovoice") and record videos ("cellphilms") documenting adaptations of their farming practices to climate change. Women mentioned fewer strategies in discussion groups compared to men and youth but took as many photos and videos. The same tools have been used to empower women to record health issues and community needs; it is the first time they are used to provide insights on women's adaptation to climate change.

title: TARIBEAN 2: A new iron biofortified bean variety in Tanzania
narrative: Variety of biofortified iron beans released in Tanzania. Key traits of interest: 2nd wave variety with full target level for iron; high grain yield, medium size grains, white color,  bush growth habbit, well adapted for production under both optimum and stress environments.

title: TARIBEAN 4: A new iron biofortified bean variety in Tanzania
narrative: Variety of biofortified iron beans released in Tanzania. Key traits of interest:, 2nd wave variety with full target level for iron; high grain yield, medium size grains, red mottled color,  bush growth habitat, well adapted for production under both optimum and stress environments.

title: TARIBEAN 5: A new iron biofortified bean variety in Tanzania
narrative: Variety of biofortified iron beans released in Tanzania. 2nd wave variety with full target level for iron; high grain yield, medium size grains, red mottled color,  bush growth habitat, well adapted for production under both optimum and stress environments.

title: TARI 19: A new iron biofortified bean variety in Tanzania
narrative: Variety of biofortified iron beans released in Tanzania. Key traits of interest: 2nd wave variety with full target level for iron; high grain yield, medium size grains, cream-beige mottled color,  bush growth habitat, well adapted for production under both optimum and stress environments.

title: CRI-Manu: A new vitamin A biofortified cassava variety in Ghana
narrative: Variety of biofortified vitamin A cassava released in Ghana. Key traits of interest: 2nd wave variety with full target level for VitA, high root yield, good dry matter content, yellow color cassava, good root branching, well adapted for production under both optimum and stress environments.

title: CRI-Opemfo Bankye: : A new vitamin A biofortified cassava variety in Ghana
narrative: Variety of biofortified vitamin A cassava released Ghana, Key traits of interest: 2nd wave variety with full target level for VitA, high root yield, good dry matter content, yellow color cassava, good root branching, well adapted for production under both optimum and stress environments.

title: CRI-Lizzy : A new vitamin A biofortified cassava variety in Ghana
narrative: Variety of biofortified vitamin A cassava released Ghana. Key traits of interest: 2nd wave variety with full target level for VitA, high root yield, good dry matter content, yellow color cassava, good root branching, well adapted for production under both optimum and stress environments.

title: SAMMAZ 60: A new vitamin A biofortified maize variety in Nigeria
narrative: Variety of biofortified vitamin A  maize released in Nigeria. Key traits of interest: 2nd wave variety with full target level for VitA; high grain yield, bigger grains; well-adapted for production under both optimum and stress environments; tolerance to drought, low N and low P; resistance to root lodging and major maize foliar diseases prevalent in Nigeria (GLS, MSV, TLB, Ear Rot); for use as boiled and roasted.

title: Fedearroz BIOZn 035: A new zinc biofortified rice variety in Colombia
narrative: Variety of biofortified zinc rice released in Colombia. Key traits of interest: First wave variety with full target level for zinc; high grain yield, large size grains, high milling quality,  good cooking quality, well adapted for production under irrigated conditions in traditional and technified productive systems in the country, resistance to root lodging and major rice foliar diseases prevalent in Colombia.

title: Himgange: A new zinc biofortified wheat variety in Nepal
narrative: Variety of biofortified zinc wheat released in Nepal. Key traits of interest: first wave variety with full target level for zinc; high grain yield, large size grains, high milling quality, good cooking quality, well adapted for production under optimum and stress environments, resistance to root lodging and major rice foliar diseases prevalent in Nepal.

title: Panchakoshi: A new zinc biofortified wheat variety in Nepal
narrative: Variety of biofortified zinc wheat released in Nepal. Key traits of interest: first wave variety with full target level for zinc; high grain yield, large size grains, high milling quality, good cooking quality, well adapted for production under optimum and stress environments, resistance to root lodging and major rice foliar diseases prevalent in Nepal.

title: Borlaug 1000: A new zinc biofortified wheat variety in Nepal
narrative: Variety of biofortified zinc wheat released in Nepal. Key traits of interest: first wave variety with full target level for zinc; high grain yield, large size grains, high milling quality, good cooking quality, well adapted for production under optimum and stress environments, resistance to root lodging and major rice foliar diseases prevalent in Nepal.

title: Akhbar-2019: A new zinc biofortified wheat variety in Pakistan
narrative: Variety of biofortified zinc wheat released in Pakistan. Key traits of interest: first wave variety with full target level for zinc; high grain yield, large size grains, high milling quality, good cooking quality, well adapted for production under optimum and stress environments, resistance to root lodging and major rice foliar diseases prevalent in Pakistan.

title: SAMMAZ 59: A new vitamin A biofortified maize variety in Nigeria
narrative: Variety of biofortified vitamin A  maize released in Nigeria. Key traits of interest: 2nd wave variety with full target level for VitA; high grain yield, bigger grains; well-adapted for production under both optimum and stress environments; tolerance to drought, low N and low P; resistance to root lodging and major maize foliar diseases prevalent in Nigeria (GLS, MSV, TLB, Ear Rot); for use as boiled and roasted.

title: SGBIOH6: A new zinc biofortified maize variety in Colombia
narrative: Variety of biofortified zinc maize  released in Colombia. Key traits of interest: 2nd wave variety with full target level for zinc, high grain yield, bigger grains; well-adapted for production under both optimum and stress environments; tolerance to drought, low N; resistance to root lodging and major maize foliar diseases prevalent in Colombia (GLS, MSV, TLB, Ear Rot); for use as boiled and roasted.

title: CENTA Porrillo 2020: A new zinc biofortified maize variety in El Salvador
narrative: Variety of biofortified zinc maize released in El Salvador. Key traits of interest: 2nd wave variety with full target level for zinc, high grain yield, bigger grains; well-adapted for production under both optimum and stress environments; tolerance to drought, low N; resistance to root lodging and major maize foliar diseases prevalent in Salvador (GLS, MSV, TLB, Ear Rot); for use as boiled and roasted.

title: Fortaleza 17: A new zinc biofortified maize variety in Guatemala
narrative: Variety of biofortified zinc maize  released in Guatemala. Key traits of interest: 2nd wave variety with full target level for zinc, high grain yield, bigger grains; well-adapted for production under both optimum and stress environments; tolerance to drought, low N; resistance to root lodging and major maize foliar diseases prevalent in Guatemala (GLS, MSV, TLB, Ear Rot); for use as boiled and roasted.

title: Zinc Gahun-2: A new zinc biofortified wheat variety in Nepal
narrative: Variety of biofortified zinc wheat released in Nepal. Key traits of interest: first wave variety with full target level for zinc; high grain yield, large size grains, high milling quality, good cooking quality, well adapted for production under optimum and stress environments, resistance to root lodging and major rice foliar diseases prevalent in Nepal.

title: Zinc wheat-3: A new zinc biofortified wheat variety in Nepal
narrative: Variety of biofortified zinc wheat released in Nepal Key traits of interest: first wave variety with full target level for zinc; high grain yield, large size grains, high milling quality, good cooking quality, well adapted for production under optimum and stress environments, resistance to root lodging and major rice foliar diseases prevalent in Nepal.

title: INTA Las Minas: A new zinc biofortified rice variety in Nicaragua
narrative: Variety of biofortified zinc rice released in Nicaragua. Key traits of interest: First wave variety with full target level for zinc; high grain yield, large size grains, high milling quality,  good cooking quality, well adapted for production under irrigated conditions in traditional and technified productive systems in the country, resistance to root lodging and major rice foliar diseases prevalent in Nicaragua.

title: Zinc Gahun-1: A new zinc biofortified wheat variety in Nepal
narrative: Variety of biofortified zinc wheat released in Nepal. Key traits of interest: first wave variety with full target level for zinc; high grain yield, large size grains, high milling quality, good cooking quality, well adapted for production under optimum and stress environments, resistance to root lodging and major rice foliar diseases prevalent in Nepal.

title: Rasuwa black: A new iron biofortified lentil variety in Nepal
narrative: Variety of biofortified iron lentil released in Nepal Key traits of interest: 2nd wave variaty with full target level for iron; high grain yield, well adapted for production under both optimum and stress environments.

title: CRI-Mmofra Bankye : A new vitamin A biofortified cassava variety in Ghana
narrative: Variety of biofortified vitamin A cassava released Ghana. Key traits of interest: 2nd wave variety with full target level for VitA, high root yield, good dry matter content, yellow color cassava, good root branching, well adapted for production under both optimum and stress environments.

title: Biofortification Priority Index (BPI),  a composite crop-specific index that ranks countries according to their suitability for investment in biofortification
narrative: For each micronutrient crop, the BPI ranks countries in Africa, Asia, and Latin America and the Caribbean, according to the crops' potential impact for alleviating micronutrient deficiency for which the crop was bred to address. BPI 2.0 ranks 128 countries in Africa, Asia, and Latin America and the Caribbean for each of the 13 biofortified staple crops based on these criteria. Biofortification stakeholders can use this tool to guide their strategic decisions.

title: CS Dietary software system to support the  entry, management, and processing of quantitative 24-hour dietary recall survey data
narrative: CSDietary is a software program for the collection and analysis of 24-hour dietary recall data. The software is fully customizable to tailor food composition tables and recipes to region-specific foods, measurement methods, and cooking techniques. The program features an expanded food composition table, options to generate outputs for different statistical packages, and a data sharing platform on the cloud. The program is accompanied by quick guides on how to install and operate the program.

title: Methods to assess the implications of trade policies and government subsidies on food systems and nutritional outcomes in the Middle East and North Africa
narrative: This study compiles several macro- and micro-level datasets to examine the implication of food policies - mainly trade and government food subsidies - on evolving nutritional transitions and associated body weight outcomes. This approach partly overcomes the data scarcity that often hampers rigorous policy research in the MENA region. A conceptual framework through which trade policies (tariff rates) and domestic government food policies (subsidies) may affect food systems and nutritional outcomes is also provided.

title: Use of near-real-time global evidence from Google search data to estimate the immediate impacts of COVID-19 on demand for selected services
narrative: In the absence of standard economic data, this paper shows how near-real-time Google search data can be leveraged to estimate the immediate impacts of COVID-19 on demand for selected services (e.g. travel, tourism, retail trade, ICTs, delivery services) across 182 countries.

title: Fish seed business models for socially inclusive tilapia value chains in Ghana
narrative: This study develops four business model prototypes for seed multiplication and distribution to increase farmers’ access to and use of quality tilapia seed. The use of these business models has the potential to improve livelihoods for the poor, women, and youth in Ghana.

title: Project-level Women’s Empowerment in Agriculture Index for Market Inclusion (pro-WEAI+MI)
narrative: The project-level Women’s Empowerment in Agriculture Index for Market Inclusion (pro-WEAI+MI) includes the core pro-WEAI module as well as new complementary indicators to investigate barriers to market access and inclusion for different value chain actors. Whereas the WEAI and A-WEAI are more focused on the production dimension of agriculture, the project-level WEAI for market inclusion (pro-WEAI+MI) takes the tool one step further to measure empowerment across the value chain.

title: Establishment of the Maize Doubled Haploid Facility, the first public DH facility
narrative: This will be the first public DH facility for Asia and will help generate at least 25,000 DH lines per year and serve the needs of CIMMYT, national partners and seed company partners (mainly members of the International Maize Improvement Consortium)

title: Satellite monitoring  to prevent impact of drought on crop production: meteorological drought
narrative: The convergence of remote sensing and supervised learning (SL) can generate solutions for the problems arising from climate change.  A function that maps a set of variables to an output. This function can be used to predict new examples. Because they are nonparametric, these methods can mine large quantities of satellite data to capture the relationship between climate variables and crops, or successfully replace autoregressive integrated moving average  models to forecast the weather.

title: 8 promising entries from the Antenna and Reference Panels selected for use in breeding pipelines in West Africa
